cbr:
Joe and Sam are at the race track betting on horses. Joe: "You see that horse over there? He lost his last four races. I'm going to bet on him."
Sam: "Why? I think he will probably lose."
Joe: "No way, Sam. I looked up the horse's stats and he has won half his races in the past two years. Since he has lost three of his last four races, he'll have to win this race. So I'm betting the farm on him."
Sam: "Are you sure?"
Joe: "Of course I'm sure. That pony is due, man...he's due!"

Joe: "Of course I'm sure. That pony is due, man...he's due!"

cbr: Everyone wants the iPhone 11 because it's the best phone on the market!
source_article: Fortnite is the best game ever. Everyone is playing it! </s></s> Everyone wants the iPhone 11 because it's the best phone on the market!

cbr: In the 6 years that I have been practicing my new and improved brand of cognitive-humanistic-dynamic-behavioral-deconstructive-metaregressive-deontological psychotherapy (now with biofeedback!), which I developed, there has not been one published study showing that it fails to work or that it has ever harmed a patient. It is clearly one of the safest and most effective interventions ever devised.
source_article: Several years ago, a group of 10 psychologists started a psychology training program. Each of those psychologists is efficient, effective, and highly-regarded. Their training program must be efficient, effective, and highly-regarded. </s></s> In the 6 years that I have been practicing my new and improved brand of cognitive-humanistic-dynamic-behavioral-deconstructive-metaregressive-deontological psychotherapy (now with biofeedback!), which I developed, there has not been one published study showing that it fails to work or that it has ever harmed a patient. It is clearly one of the safest and most effective interventions ever devised.

 </s></s> If you break your diet and have one cookie tonight, you will just want to eat 10 cookies tomorrow, and before you know it, you will have gained back the 15 pounds you lost. This is an example of which logical fallacy?

Speaker 1: Right here, in the Bible.

cbr: Power lines cause cancer. I met a little boy with cancer who lived just 20 miles from a power line who looked into my eyes and said, in his weak voice, “Please do whatever you can so that other kids won’t have to go through what I am going through.” I urge you to vote for this bill to tear down all power lines and replace them with monkeys on treadmills.

cbr: argues that a proposition is true because it has not yet been proven false

cbr: That type of car is poorly made; a friend of mine has one, and it continually gives him trouble.
source_article:
John: Can you please help me push my car to the side of the road until the tow truck comes?
Paul: Why push it to the side of the road?  Why not just leave it?
John: It is slowing down traffic unnecessarily where it is.
Paul: Many things slow down traffic—do you feel you need to do something about all them?
John: No, but this was my fault.
Paul: Was it really? Were you the direct cause of your car breaking down?
John: Are you going to help me move this damn car or not?!
 </s></s> That type of car is poorly made; a friend of mine has one, and it continually gives him trouble.

cbr: “This is how most schools evaluate their students, so it must be effective.”
source_article:
While doing research for her debate topic on school uniforms, Sara discovered that a local elementary school survey indicated that 72% of its 1st graders wanted uniforms. She used this as evidence to support that all high schools should wear school uniforms.
What fallacy did Sara use here? </s></s> “This is how most schools evaluate their students, so it must be effective.”

cbr: If you accept that the story of Adam and Eve was figurative, then you will do the same for most of the Old Testament stories of similar literary styles.  Once you are there, the New Testament and the story of Jesus does not make sense, which will lead you to believe that the resurrection of Jesus was a “spiritual” one.  Once you accept that, you won’t be a Christian anymore; you will be a dirty atheist, then you will have no morals and start having sex with animals of a barnyard nature.  So you better take the story of Adam and Eve literally, before the phrase, “that chicken looks delicious”, takes on a whole new meaning.

cbr: Mr. Equalminded's idea for implementing affirmative action in the university's admission process is complete folly. He says he wants the student body to represent diversity in the community. But that's ridiculous. I suppose this means we'll have to throw out our academic standards while were at it. After all, if we're going to let students into our prestigious institution just because of their gender of the color of their skin, then what's going to happen to our reputation?
source_article: Affirmative Action can never be fair or just. You cannot remedy one injustice by committing another. </s></s> Mr. Equalminded's idea for implementing affirmative action in the university's admission process is complete folly. He says he wants the student body to represent diversity in the community. But that's ridiculous. I suppose this means we'll have to throw out our academic standards while were at it. After all, if we're going to let students into our prestigious institution just because of their gender of the color of their skin, then what's going to happen to our reputation?

Evolution happened.
Therefore, God did not create the world. </s></s> God did not create the world six thousand years ago because matter has always existed, and therefore the world has always existed.

cbr:
Ted: Biological evolution is both a theory and a fact.

Edwin: That is ridiculous!  How can you possibly be absolutely certain that we evolved from pond scum!

Ted: Actually, that is a gross misrepresentation of my assertion.  I never claimed we evolved from pond scum.  Unlike math and logic, science is based on empirical evidence and, therefore, a scientific fact is something that is confirmed to such a degree that it would be perverse to withhold provisional consent.  The empirical evidence for the fact that biological evolution does occur falls into this category.

gun registration would start us sliding into the unconstitutional morass of universal arms confiscation. </s></s> John: We should oppose any attempt to register firearms. Such regulation is the first step to confiscation of all weapons and the elimination of our constitutional right to bear arms.

cbr: Violence among teens has risen the last five years. Video game playing among teens has also risen the last five years. Therefore, playing video games causes teens to be violent.

The report notes that nationally, violent crime fell every year from 1993 to 2004, before rising in 2005 and 2006, just as 'America’s streets filled with millions of people visibly wearing, and being distracted by, expensive electronic gear.' </s></s> Violence among teens has risen the last five years. Video game playing among teens has also risen the last five years. Therefore, playing video games causes teens to be violent.

cbr: involves acceptance or rejection of concepts based on their source, not their merit
source_article:
Ken: There has to be an objective morality because otherwise terms like “right” and “wrong” would be meaningless since they have no foundation for comparison. 
Rob: The terms “right” and “wrong” are based on cultural norms, which do have a subjective foundation -- one that changes as the moral sphere of the culture changes.  The term “heavy” does not have an objective standard, yet we have no problem using that term in a meaningful way.  In fact, very few relational terms have any kind of objective foundation.
Ken: But without an objective morality, we would all be lost morally as a race.
Rob: Many would say that we are.
Ken: But how can you say that torturing children for fun is morally acceptable in any situation?
Rob: Personally, I wouldn’t, but you are implying that anything that is not objective must necessarily be seen in all possible ways. A feather may not be seen as “heavy” to anyone, but that doesn’t mean its “lightness” is still not relative to other objects.
Ken: But God is the standard of objective morality.  Prove that wrong!
Rob: That I cannot do.
 </s></s> involves acceptance or rejection of concepts based on their source, not their merit

cbr: fallacy suggesting that because everyone believes something or does something, it must be valid, accurate, or effective.
source_article: This fallacy assumes something is true (or right, or good) because other people agree with it. </s></s> fallacy suggesting that because everyone believes something or does something, it must be valid, accurate, or effective.

cbr: My teacher always brings up stuff about Women's Rights. She only cares about it because she is a woman. The stats she shows us are probably bias.
source_article: Bill: "You know, those feminists all hate men." Joe: "Really?" Bill: "Yeah. I was in my philosophy class the other day and that Rachel chick gave a presentation." Joe: "Which Rachel?" Bill: "You know her. She's the one that runs that feminist group over at the Women's Center. She said that men are all sexist pigs. I asked her why she believed this and she said that her last few boyfriends were real sexist pigs. " Joe: "That doesn't sound like a good reason to believe that all of us are pigs." Bill: "That was what I said." Joe: "What did she say?" Bill: "She said that she had seen enough of men to know we are all pigs. She obviously hates all men." Joe: "So you think all feminists are like her?" Bill: "Sure. They all hate men." </s></s> My teacher always brings up stuff about Women's Rights. She only cares about it because she is a woman. The stats she shows us are probably bias.

cbr:
Ted: Biological evolution is both a theory and a fact.
Edwin: That is ridiculous!  How can you possibly be absolutely certain that we evolved from pond scum!
Ted: Actually, that is a gross misrepresentation of my assertion.  I never claimed we evolved from pond scum.  Unlike math and logic, science is based on empirical evidence and, therefore, a scientific fact is something that is confirmed to such a degree that it would be perverse to withhold provisional consent.  The empirical evidence for the fact that biological evolution does occur falls into this category.

cbr: "I used to have that haircut. Then my mom got a job."
source_article: "My brother's girlfriend's Mother's hairdresser said that COVID numbers are going down, so I'm not going to bother with my mask" IS an example of this fallacy. </s></s> "I used to have that haircut. Then my mom got a job."

cbr: Officer, I was only driving as fast as everyone around me. You can't give me a ticket for doing what every other driver on the road was also doing.
source_article: "Everyone was driving over the speed limit, so I shouldn't have gotten a ticket for it!" is an example of which logical fallacy? </s></s> Officer, I was only driving as fast as everyone around me. You can't give me a ticket for doing what every other driver on the road was also doing.

cbr: "I started exercising twice a week, and I just got a babysitting job. Exercising leads to new jobs!"
source_article: I am athletic because I run, and I run because I'm athletic. </s></s> "I started exercising twice a week, and I just got a babysitting job. Exercising leads to new jobs!"

cbr:
FlatSam: Common sense tells us that if the earth were a sphere, people on the bottom would fall off.
ReasonEric: I don’t think you get to reference something you clearly don’t have.
source_article:
If it wasn't a missile, a bomb, or mechanical failure, then all that's left is a meteorite. </s></s> FlatSam: Common sense tells us that if the earth were a sphere, people on the bottom would fall off.
ReasonEric: I don’t think you get to reference something you clearly don’t have.

cbr: You moved the goalposts or made up an exception when your claim was shown to be false.
source_article: Moving the goalposts or making up exceptions when a claim is shown to be false. </s></s> You moved the goalposts or made up an exception when your claim was shown to be false.

cbr: You're with us or you're against us.
source_article: Either you are with me or you are against me. </s></s> You're with us or you're against us.

cbr: Sugar is an essential component of the body...a key material in all sorts of metabolic processes,' neglecting the fact that it is glucose (blood sugar) not ordinary table sugar (sucrose) that is the vital nourishment.

cbr: Luke didn't want to eat his sheep's brains with chopped liver and brussel sprouts, but his father told him to think about the poor, starving children in a third world country who weren't fortunate enough to have any food at all.
source_article: Luke didn't want to eat his vegetables, but his father told him to think about the poor, starving children in a third world country who don't have anything to eat. </s></s> Luke didn't want to eat his sheep's brains with chopped liver and brussel sprouts, but his father told him to think about the poor, starving children in a third world country who weren't fortunate enough to have any food at all.

cbr:
All Paul Newman movies are great.
All great movies are Oscar winners.
Therefore, all Oscar winners are Paul Newman movies.
source_article:
All Jim Carrey movies are hilarious.
No horror movies are Jim Carrey movies.
Therefore, no horror movies are hilarious. </s></s> All Paul Newman movies are great.
All great movies are Oscar winners.
Therefore, all Oscar winners are Paul Newman movies.

cbr: Two words: New Coke.
source_article: Coke is not as healthy for you as Pepsi. Besides, Britney Spears drinks Pepsi, so it must be healthier than Coke. </s></s> Two words: New Coke.

cbr: If you break your diet and have one cookie tonight, you will just want to eat 10 cookies tomorrow, and before you know it, you will have gained back the 15 pounds you lost. This is an example of which logical fallacy?
source_article: If you break your diet and have one cookie tonight, you will just want to eat 10 cookies tomorrow, and before you know it, you will have gained back the 15 pounds you lost. </s></s> If you break your diet and have one cookie tonight, you will just want to eat 10 cookies tomorrow, and before you know it, you will have gained back the 15 pounds you lost. source_article: My fridge isn't working. I should probably finish that book I've been reading. </s></s> I would have done my homework, but my refrigerator stopped working.

"I know I made a bad decision, but look at how hard I tried."

This helps manipulators to avoid taking responsibility for their actions.

cbr: Bill: "You know, those feminists all hate men." Joe: "Really?" Bill: "Yeah. I was in my philosophy class the other day and that Rachel chick gave a presentation." Joe: "Which Rachel?" Bill: "You know her. She's the one that runs that feminist group over at the Women's Center. She said that men are all sexist pigs. I asked her why she believed this and she said that her last few boyfriends were real sexist pigs. " Joe: "That doesn't sound like a good reason to believe that all of us are pigs." Bill: "That was what I said." Joe: "What did she say?" Bill: "She said that she had seen enough of men to know we are all pigs. She obviously hates all men." Joe: "So you think all feminists are like her?" Bill: "Sure. They all hate men."
source_article: My teacher always brings up stuff about Women's Rights. She only cares about it because she is a woman. cbr: This fallacy suggests that unlikely or ridiculous outcomes are likely when there’s just not enough evidence to think so.
source_article: You can’t prove your candidate will win, so I assume he won’t </s></s> This fallacy suggests that unlikely or ridiculous outcomes are likely when there’s just not enough evidence to think so.

cbr: Most people believe in ghosts, so ghosts are real.
source_article:
All ghosts are imaginary.
All unicorns are imaginary.
Therefore, all ghosts are unicorns. </s></s> Most people believe in ghosts, so ghosts are real.

cbr: Kelly is the most selfish, annoying person that I know. She says that we should recycle to help save the Earth, but she only thinks about herself, so she must be wrong.

cbr: The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise.
source_article: Every sunrise, the rooster makes a sound. So it is the rooster which makes the sun rise. </s></s> The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise.

cbr: My new way of obtaining informed consent helps prevent dropouts. I chose the three therapists in our clinic who had the highest dropout rates and taught them my new informed consent procedure. The first month that they started using it, all three had significantly lower dropout rates.
source_article: My new sport psychology intervention works! I chose the player with the lowest batting average based on the last game from each of the teams in our amateur baseball league. Then I gave each of them my 5-minute intervention. And almost all of them improved their batting average in the next game!" Earthquakes are caused when the plates of the Earth's crust move. Earthquakes happen along "fault lines" in the earth’s crust. When the plates in the Earth suddenly shift, the Earth will begin to shift, shake or tremble.
What is the central idea? </s></s> Person A: I think pollution from humans contributes to climate change.
Person B: So, you think humans are directly responsible for extreme weather, like hurricanes, and have caused the droughts in the southwestern U.S.?

cbr: The number of pirates in existence decreased as the global average temperature rose. Therefore, we can conclude that hotter weather reduces piracy.

cbr:
Andy states that a Scotsman would never put sugar on his porridge. Dougal replies that he is a Scotsman and he does put sugar on his porridge. Andy counters that no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge.

Andy thus changes the terms of the argument, implying that Dougal is not a "true" Scotsman in order to support his own position.
source_article:
Bruce is American, or he is not from New Jersey.
Bruce is not American, therefore, he is not from New Jersey. </s></s> Andy states that a Scotsman would never put sugar on his porridge. Dougal replies that he is a Scotsman and he does put sugar on his porridge. Andy counters that no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge.

Andy thus changes the terms of the argument, implying that Dougal is not a "true" Scotsman in order to support his own position.

cbr: This tactic plays upon a viewer's lack of knowledge by forcing the idea that the situation is static. Unless the audience is well-informed and aware of this deception, they may think that they have only two choices.

Ernie: Think of it as a little guy in your brain watching the movie projected by your eyes.

 </s></s> This tactic plays upon a viewer's lack of knowledge by forcing the idea that the situation is static. Unless the audience is well-informed and aware of this deception, they may think that they have only two choices.

source_article: or group in order to discredit an idea with which the person or group is associated; distracts the reader from the real issue </s></s> uses irrelevant information or other techniques to distract from the argument at hand

cbr: Putting teenagers in sex-education classes is like taking an alcoholic to a bar.
source_article: Allowing overnight guests in the dorm rooms will lead to nothing but trouble: promiscuity, teen pregnancy, and eventually, a bunch of unwed mothers on campus, trying to complete their degrees while raising a child. </s></s> Putting teenagers in sex-education classes is like taking an alcoholic to a bar.

cbr: My teacher says the Earth is flat, so it definitely is flat.
source_article: I don’t care what scientists say, my mother always told me that the world is flat, and she would never lie to me! </s></s> My teacher says the Earth is flat, so it definitely is flat.

cbr: Recognising that Amanda had committed a fallacy in arguing that we should eat healthy food because a nutritionist said it was popular, Alyse said we should therefore eat bacon double cheeseburgers every day.
source_article: You should eat more green leafy vegetables, because Ms. Lord says so, and she is an expert on grammar and vocabulary. </s></s> Recognising that Amanda had committed a fallacy in arguing that we should eat healthy food because a nutritionist said it was popular, Alyse said we should therefore eat bacon double cheeseburgers every day.

cbr: If I’m psychic, I will be able to see dead people. I see dead people, therefore I’m psychic.
source_article: Paranormal activity is real because I've seen a ghost. </s></s> If I’m psychic, I will be able to see dead people. I see dead people, therefore I’m psychic.

cbr: My mother has always told me not to drink milk after eating fish because she knows a friend whose skin got patched after drinking milk and eating fish together. Besides, many other people have told me the same thing so it must be true.
source_article: My mother always told me that if I went outside right after bathing, during winter, I would catch pneumonia. </s></s> My mother has always told me not to drink milk after eating fish because she knows a friend whose skin got patched after drinking milk and eating fish together. Besides, many other people have told me the same thing so it must be true.

cbr: A misrepresentation of an opponent’s position that makes it easier to argue against
source_article: occurs when your opponent over-simplifies or misrepresents your argument (i.e., setting up a "straw man") to make it easier to attack or refute </s></s> A misrepresentation of an opponent’s position that makes it easier to argue against

cbr: America has to act now to reduce illegal immigration. Recent studies show that the vast majority of Americans think that illegal immigration is a problem.
source_article: We cannot support immigrants because we have too many homeless and poor Americans. </s></s> America has to act now to reduce illegal immigration. Recent studies show that the vast majority of Americans think that illegal immigration is a problem.

cbr:
Consider the following exchange:
Lindsey: I think capital punishment is a necessary component of our justice system and should remain legal.
Kayla: So you are saying that murder should be legal and it is okay for us to go around killing people just because we think they deserve it? That isn't right.
Of what fallacy is Kayla guilty?

Consider the following exchange:
Omar: I think capital punishment is a necessary component of our justice system and should remain legal.
Kayla: So you are saying that murder should be legal and it is okay for us to go around killing people just because we think they deserve it? That isn't right.
Of what fallacy is Kayla guilty? </s></s> Consider the following exchange:

Kayla: So you are saying that murder should be legal and it is okay for us to go around killing people just because we think they deserve it? That isn't right.

source_article: Sometimes flu vaccines don’t work, therefore vaccines are useless. </s></s> Some people say that the coronavirus is dangerous. Others say that it is not dangerous. That must mean that some coronavirus vaccinations are fine while others are not.

Timmy: Mom, what if I don’t believe in God?
Mom: Then you burn in Hell forever.  Why do you ask?
Timmy: No reason.
 </s></s> If you do not believe in God, you will go to hell.

cbr: People generally like to walk on the beach. Beaches have sand. Therefore, having sand floors in homes would be a great idea!
source_article: "People generally like to walk on the beach. Beaches have sand. Therefore, having sand floors in homes would be a great idea!" </s></s> People generally like to walk on the beach. Beaches have sand. Therefore, having sand floors in homes would be a great idea!

cbr:
Andy states that a Scotsman would never put sugar on his porridge. Dougal replies that he is a Scotsman and he does put sugar on his porridge. Andy counters that no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge.

Andy thus changes the terms of the argument, implying that Dougal is not a "true" Scotsman in order to support his own position.
source_article:
Angus declares that Scotsmen do not put sugar on their porridge, to which Lachlan points out that he is a Scotsman and puts sugar on his porridge. Furious, like a true Scot, Angus yells that no true Scotsman sugars his porridge. </s></s> Andy states that a Scotsman would never put sugar on his porridge. Dougal replies that he is a Scotsman and he does put sugar on his porridge. Andy counters that no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge.

Andy thus changes the terms of the argument, implying that Dougal is not a "true" Scotsman in order to support his own position.

source_article: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed because he made them in a bathtub and not a proper university laboratory. </s></s> What is the name of the fallacy in question 4 about Marcus?

This is an example of... </s></s> At soccer practice, Willeidy tells Aida, "Pace's soccer team was losing until I bought new shoes. We have not lost a game since I got my lucky shoes!"

cbr:
BILL CLINTON: But when Joe McCarthy went around this country attacking people’s patriotism, he was wrong. He was wrong. And a senator from Connecticut stood up to him named Prescott Bush. Your father was right to stand up to Joe McCarthy, you were wrong to attack my patriotism. I was opposed to the war but I loved my country… Debate 1,
October 11, 1992
St. Louis, Missouri
What logical fallacy did Clinton’s statement employ?
source_article:
"That politician wants you to think he loves America. His last rally had 20 American flags flying behind him" IS an example of this fallacy. </s></s> BILL CLINTON: But when Joe McCarthy went around this country attacking people’s patriotism, he was wrong. October 11, 1992

cbr: uses irrelevant information or other techniques to distract from the argument at hand

cbr: Power lines cause cancer.  I met a little boy with cancer who lived just 20 miles from a power line who looked into my eyes and said, in his weak voice, “Please do whatever you can so that other kids won’t have to go through what I am going through.”  I urge you to vote for this bill to tear down all power lines and replace them with monkeys on treadmills.
source_article: Power lines cause cancer. I met a little boy with cancer who lived just 20 miles from a power line who looked into my eyes and said, in his weak voice, “Please do whatever you can so that other kids won’t have to go through what I am going through.” I urge you to vote for this bill to tear down all power lines and replace them with monkeys on treadmills. </s></s> Power lines cause cancer.  I met a little boy with cancer who lived just 20 miles from a power line who looked into my eyes and said, in his weak voice, “Please do whatever you can so that other kids won’t have to go through what I am going through.”  I urge you to vote for this bill to tear down all power lines and replace them with monkeys on treadmills.

cbr: “My boss isn’t willing to increase the number of vacation days we get each year. That means she doesn’t care about our health. It’s wrong not to care about employees’ health. She should be replaced with someone who cares about the employees.”
source_article:
Melvin: Boss, why do I have to work weekends when nobody else in the company does?
Boss: Am I sensing insubordination?  I can find another employee very quickly, thanks to Craigslist, you know.
 </s></s> “My boss isn’t willing to increase the number of vacation days we get each year. That means she doesn’t care about our health. It’s wrong not to care about employees’ health. She should be replaced with someone who cares about the employees.”

cbr: Saying that because one finds something difficult to understand, therefore it's not true

cbr: In 2011, Christian broadcaster, Harold Camping, (once again) predicted the end of the world via Jesus, and managed to get many Christians to join his alarmist campaign.  During this time, and especially after the Armageddon date had passed,  many Christian groups publicly declared that Camping is not a “true Christian”.  On a personal note, I think Camping was and is as much of a Christian as any other self-proclaimed Christian and religious/political/ethical beliefs aside, I give him credit for having the cojones to make a falsifiable claim about his religious beliefs.Example #2:
source_article:

cbr:
Person 1: I think pollution from humans contributes to climate change.

Person 2: So, you think humans are directly responsible for extreme weather, like hurricanes, and have caused the droughts in the southwestern U.S.? If that’s the case, maybe we just need to go to the southwest and perform a “rain dance.”
source_article:
Farmer McDonald: Ever since they put up that new power plant across the river, we haven't had a bit of rain. I'm tellin' you, mankind has got too big for its britches when it fiddles around with nature. </s></s> Person 1: I think pollution from humans contributes to climate change.

Person 2: So, you think humans are directly responsible for extreme weather, like hurricanes, and have caused the droughts in the southwestern U.S.? If that’s the case, maybe we just need to go to the southwest and perform a “rain dance.”

source_article: My doctor is overweight, so I don't believe anything he tells me about improving my health. </s></s> "I can't trust that doctor's advice on how to raise my child. He has never been a mother."

cbr: A fallacy which assumes that because something is popular, it is therefore good, correct, or desirable.
source_article: This happens when you assume that something is acceptable just because it is very common. </s></s> A fallacy which assumes that because something is popular, it is therefore good, correct, or desirable.

source_article: I know you don’t like the kitty-cat sweater that Grandma knitted for you, but she worked so hard on it and it will make her happy to see you wear it in the family holiday photo. </s></s> I know you don't like the kitty-cat sweater that Grandma knitted for you, but she worked so hard on it and it will make her happy to see you wear it in the family holiday photo.

cbr: All living beings come from other living beings.  Therefore, the first forms of life must have come from a living being.  That living being is God.
source_article:
Dicky: So how do you think life began?
Ralphie: Simple.  Aliens from another planet seeded this planet with life billions of years ago.
Dicky: OK, but how did that alien life form begin?
Ralphie: Simple.  Aliens from another planet seeded that planet with life.
 </s></s> All living beings come from other living beings.  Therefore, the first forms of life must have come from a living being.  That living being is God.

cbr: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.
source_article: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Annie Smith is the best-liked CEO in our company's history. </s></s> Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.

cbr: Everybody loves Raymond because he is so popular. Popular people are loved by everybody.
source_article: Justin Beiber wears Ray Bans, so you should buy a pair to wear in the sun. </s></s> Everybody loves Raymond because he is so popular. Popular people are loved by everybody.

cbr: The Bible is the Word of God because God tells us it is... in the Bible.
source_article: God exists because the Bible says so. The Bible is a reliable source because it is the  word of God. </s></s> The Bible is the Word of God because God tells us it is... in the Bible.

cbr: "Politician X is going to strip away your right to free speech!"

It's not my fault my doctor won't give me authorization. </s></s> I’m not a doctor, but I play a doctor on TV, and I wouldn’t dream of using anything but Tylenol for my toughest headaches.

cbr: Which fallacy is used to promote something based on popularity?
source_article: "Everyone uses Social Media to fundraise, therefore there's no problem with asking for money on social media sites as long as it's going to charity" SHOWS evidence of what fallacy? </s></s> Which fallacy is used to promote something based on popularity?

cbr: Students only want cell phones so they can text their friends in class; it's about time students focused more on their studies and less on their social lives.

Person #2: Oh, so you think we should all just sleep in until noon and have school until it gets dark? </s></s> It’s getting late, and we still have to decide on the school budget. What do you say we just leave it as is and we can call it a night?

cbr: Mayor: During my previous term as mayor my staff and I spent a great deal of time focusing on our city’s economy, and unemployment reached an all-time high as a result. So clearly you should support my re-election campaign if you are among those still looking for a job.
source_article: "You asked me why the unemployment rate has increased once more, but I'm going to tell you what has an even worse effect on morale in this country." </s></s> Mayor: During my previous term as mayor my staff and I spent a great deal of time focusing on our city’s economy, and unemployment reached an all-time high as a result. So clearly you should support my re-election campaign if you are among those still looking for a job.

cbr: People who wear glasses are smarter.
source_article: People who read are smart. </s></s> People who wear glasses are smarter.

cbr: I think that we should reject what Father Jones has to say about the ethical issues of abortion because he is a Catholic priest. After all, Father Jones is required to hold such views
source_article: He was born to Catholic parents and raised as a Catholic until his confirmation in 8th grade.  Therefore, he is bound to want to defend some Catholic traditions and, therefore, cannot be taken seriously. </s></s> I think that we should reject what Father Jones has to say about the ethical issues of abortion because he is a Catholic priest. After all, Father Jones is required to hold such views

cbr:
"Dra. Vicky Belo said that all kind of cars need fuel to start."

What fallacy is being committed in the sentence above?
source_article:
Pvt. Joe Bowers: What are these electrolytes? Do you even know?
Secretary of State: They're... what they use to make Brawndo!
Pvt. Joe Bowers: But why do they use them to make Brawndo?
Secretary of Defense: [raises hand after a pause] Because Brawndo's got electrolytes. </s></s> "Dra. Vicky Belo said that all kind of cars need fuel to start."

What fallacy is being committed in the sentence above?

cbr: I ate Oreos, and then I was sick the next day. It must have been the Oreos that caused my sickness.
source_article: All Greek food causes illness;  when I traveled through Greece, I got food  poisoning. </s></s> I ate Oreos, and then I was sick the next day. It must have been the Oreos that caused my sickness.

cbr: You have to give me a passing grade. I spent 150 hours on that project and missed every party this quarter.
source_article: “I really deserve an “A” on this paper, professor. Not only did I study during my grandmother’s funeral, but I also passed up the heart transplant surgery, even though that was the first matching donor in 3 years.” </s></s> You have to give me a passing grade. I spent 150 hours on that project and missed every party this quarter.

cbr:
All Catholics are Christian.
All Christians are Jesus lovers.
Therefore, all Jesus lovers are Catholic.
source_article:
If everyone lived his or her life exactly like Jesus lived his life, the world would be a beautiful place! </s></s> All Catholics are Christian.
All Christians are Jesus lovers.
Therefore, all Jesus lovers are Catholic.

cbr: “I don’t understand why you’re saying I broke a promise. I said I’d never speak again to my ex-girlfriend. And I didn’t. I just sent her a quick text.”
source_article: I called my friend and he didn't answer. He wasn't home or he was dead. </s></s> “I don’t understand why you’re saying I broke a promise. I said I’d never speak again to my ex-girlfriend. And I didn’t. I just sent her a quick text.”

cbr:
First senator: The nation is in debt and we should not add to the defense budget.
Second senator: I cannot believe you want to leave the nation defenseless!
source_article:
Senator A: "We should spend less on our military budget and spend more on health and education."
Senator B: "So you want to leave the country defenseless?" </s></s> First senator: The nation is in debt and we should not add to the defense budget.
Second senator: I cannot believe you want to leave the nation defenseless!

cbr: That lady had a rough day today. She woke up late, she was not able to eat breakfast, she missed the train and was late for work. My heart aches for this poor lady.
source_article: My Aunt was in the hospital for 6 weeks because she didn't wear a seatbelt. </s></s> That lady had a rough day today. She woke up late, she was not able to eat breakfast, she missed the train and was late for work. My heart aches for this poor lady.

cbr: When Donald Trump called Hillary Clinton “Killary” to discredit her and her reputation as a presidential candidate, he committed which logical fallacy?
source_article: "Trump won't release his tax returns and prove he's clean, therefore he must have something to hide." </s></s> When Donald Trump called Hillary Clinton “Killary” to discredit her and her reputation as a presidential candidate, he committed which logical fallacy?

cbr:
Mother: You should stop smoking. It's harmful to your health.
Daughter: Why should I listen to you? You started smoking when you were 16!
source_article:
Jack: You should stop smoking - it's bad for you.
Jill: Look who's talking! You smoke three packs a day! </s></s> Mother: You should stop smoking. It's harmful to your health.
Daughter: Why should I listen to you? You started smoking when you were 16!

cbr: You say that we have exaggerated the problem with global warming, but have you even considered how much more the homeless suffer when temperatures soar?
source_article:
I. The Ganges river is flooded due to large sheets of ice coming down from the Himalayas.
II. Many people in the Himalayan ranges lost their houses under huge sheets of ice. </s></s> You say that we have exaggerated the problem with global warming, but have you even considered how much more the homeless suffer when temperatures soar?

cbr: "Either you recycle or you don't care about human life."
source_article: If you don't have a recycling bin you hate the earth and don't care about pollution. </s></s> "Either you recycle or you don't care about human life."

cbr: Violence among teens has risen the last five years. Video game playing among teens has also risen the last five years. Therefore, playing video games causes teens to be violent.
source_article: During the first week of July ice cream sales climbed, and during the second week murder rates climbed. Therefore, ice cream inspires murder. </s></s> Violence among teens has risen the last five years. Video game playing among teens has also risen the last five years. Therefore, playing video games causes teens to be violent.

cbr: Only fools are out in public right now. Careful people are staying home.
source_article: All engineers are introverts who would rather relate to computers than people.  </s></s> Only fools are out in public right now. Careful people are staying home.

cbr:
Hannah argues that because her friend was brainwashed as a child into thinking that people are generally good, people are not generally good.
Name that fallacy:
source_article:
Christine has a terrible experience with a boyfriend. She decides that all boys are mean. This is an example of which logical fallacy? </s></s> Hannah argues that because her friend was brainwashed as a child into thinking that people are generally good, people are not generally good.
Name that fallacy:

cbr: The greatest thing that we can do is to love each other. Love is better than any other emotion.
source_article: “If you really loved me, you would buy me everything I ever wanted!” </s></s> The greatest thing that we can do is to love each other. Love is better than any other emotion.

cbr: My philosophy professor believes in ghosts and goes to séances. She’s an intelligent, educated, person, so ghosts must be real, and spiritualism must be true.
source_article: My professor, who has a Ph.D. in Astronomy, once told me that ghosts are real. Therefore, ghosts are real. </s></s> My philosophy professor believes in ghosts and goes to séances. She’s an intelligent, educated, person, so ghosts must be real, and spiritualism must be true.

cbr: If we allow euthanasia, the next thing you know, murder will be legal.
source_article: "That's what abortion is - killing innocent humans for money. Abortionists are government licensed hit men." </s></s> If we allow euthanasia, the next thing you know, murder will be legal.

cbr: It is ridiculous to have spent thousands of dollars to rescue those two whales trapped in the Arctic ice. Why look at all the people trapped in jobs they don’t like.
source_article: It is ridiculous to have spent thousands of dollars to rescue those two whales trapped in the Arctic ice. Why, look at all the people trapped in jobs they don’t like. </s></s> It is ridiculous to have spent thousands of dollars to rescue those two whales trapped in the Arctic ice. Why look at all the people trapped in jobs they don’t like.

cbr: Just give me a chance to prove it to you. I can’t live this life if you will leave me. My world will stop to turn around. I will not be able to eat nor drink.
source_article:
Audrey: I am a human being. I am not a cyborg from the future here to destroy humanity.

Fred: Prove that you are human! Cyborgs don't pass out when they lose a lot of blood. Here's a knife.

Audrey: Get to bed, Freddie. And no more SYFY channel before bed! </s></s> Just give me a chance to prove it to you. I can’t live this life if you will leave me. My world will stop to turn around. I will not be able to eat nor drink.

cbr: My brother Humza eats cheeseburgers and pizza. He is thin. Cheeseburgers and pizza aren’t the cause of obesity.
source_article: Beyond Meat burgers are healthy for us because they do not have any meat in them. </s></s> My brother Humza eats cheeseburgers and pizza. He is thin. Cheeseburgers and pizza aren’t the cause of obesity.

cbr: someone who is poor is more credible than someone who is rich?
source_article: We should give the other applicant the job because he has a poor family and he needs to provide for them. It looks like he suffers a lot! </s></s> someone who is poor is more credible than someone who is rich?

cbr: Everything I say is true. This is true because I said it, and everything I say is true.
source_article: According to my brain, my brain is reliable. </s></s> Everything I say is true. This is true because I said it, and everything I say is true.

cbr: The spider that bit was poison, therefore all spiders are poison.
source_article: "Coronavirus originated in China, therefore all Chinese people are sick." </s></s> The spider that bit was poison, therefore all spiders are poison.

cbr: “If America doesn’t send weapons to the Syrian rebels, they won’t be able to defend themselves against their warring dictator. They’ll lose their civil war, and that dictator will oppress them, and the Soviets will consequently carve out a sphere of influence that spreads across the entire Middle East.
source_article: Whilst rallying support for his plan to fundamentally undermine citizens' rights, the Supreme Leader told the people they were either on his side, or they were on the side of the enemy. </s></s> “If America doesn’t send weapons to the Syrian rebels, they won’t be able to defend themselves against their warring dictator. They’ll lose their civil war, and that dictator will oppress them, and the Soviets will consequently carve out a sphere of influence that spreads across the entire Middle East.

cbr: You should never gamble! Once you start gambling you find it hard to stop. Soon you will spend all your money on gambling, and eventually you will turn to crime just to support your gambling addiction.
source_article:
You should never gamble! Once you start gambling you find it hard to stop. Soon you will spend all your money on gambling, and eventually you will turn to crime just to support your gambling addiction.
¡Nunca debes apostar! Una vez que empiece a jugar, le resultará difícil dejar de jugar. Pronto gastará todo su dinero en juegos de azar y, finalmente, recurrirá a la delincuencia solo para apoyar su adicción al juego. </s></s> You should never gamble! Once you start gambling you find it hard to stop. Soon you will spend all your money on gambling, and eventually you will turn to crime just to support your gambling addiction.

cbr: I should receive an 'A' in this class. After all, if I don't get an 'A' I won't get the fellowship that I want.

cbr: I know you don't like the kitty-cat sweater that Grandma knitted for you, but she worked so hard on it and it will make her happy to see you wear it in the family holiday photo.
source_article: I know you don't like the kitty-cat  sweater that Grandma knitted for you, but she worked so hard on it and it will make her happy to see you wear it in the family holiday photo. </s></s> I know you don't like the kitty-cat sweater that Grandma knitted for you, but she worked so hard on it and it will make her happy to see you wear it in the family holiday photo.

cbr: Argues that "we've always done it that way." In other words, because something worked in the past, it is the correct thing to do.
source_article:
We're going to celebrate New Year's Eve this way because that's how we've always done it.
This is an example of ... </s></s> Argues that "we've always done it that way." In other words, because something worked in the past, it is the correct thing to do.

cbr: Mayor Kerr wants to create more bicycle lanes in Greenpoint. Why is he forcing us to give up our cars and bike everywhere?
source_article: A local politician plans to expand the municipality's cycle network and to add several new speed cameras in densely populated areas. Their opponent says, "They want us all to give up driving forever. They're punishing the honest car owners and commuters that help pay these politicians' salaries." </s></s> Mayor Kerr wants to create more bicycle lanes in Greenpoint. Why is he forcing us to give up our cars and bike everywhere?

cbr: Order is necessary to justice because justice can only be achieved by a program of social and legal order.
source_article: All judges are fair-minded individuals;  therefore, Judge Ito is fair in his decisions. </s></s> Order is necessary to justice because justice can only be achieved by a program of social and legal order.

only man is rational
no women is man

This is why a woman shouldn’t do a man's job </s></s> only man is rational
no women is man
Therefore, no women is rational

cbr: Today late for ten minutes, tomorrow late for an hour, and then someday you will simply cease to show up.
source_article: If we allow Susan to leave early, soon we'll be giving everyone Friday afternoon off. </s></s> Today late for ten minutes, tomorrow late for an hour, and then someday you will simply cease to show up.

cbr: Education is important for the future of the American people and our country.   So, you should choose to study at St. Cloud State University.
source_article:
"I want my daughter to go to a state university so she can avoid too much debt."
"Why do you think state schools are better than private schools? Harvard and Princeton are private." What is this? </s></s> Education is important for the future of the American people and our country.   So, you should choose to study at St. Cloud State University.

cbr: "In his class president election video, he called his student opponent 'a brown-nosing, suck up who only wanted to get on the teacher's good side,' which got him disqualified" IS an example of THIS fallacy.
source_article:

Which logical fallacy is represented here? </s></s> "In his class president election video, he called his student opponent 'a brown-nosing, suck up who only wanted to get on the teacher's good side,' which got him disqualified" IS an example of THIS fallacy.

source_article: Children should not listen to rap music. Everyone knows that. </s></s> Sometimes kids ride skateboards and fall off, breaking their arms or legs. Clearly, riding a skateboard is extremely dangerous. Don’t you think skateboards should be banned?

source_article: I had a real bad headache, then saw my doctor.  Just by talking with him, my headache started to subside, and I was all better the next day.  It was well worth the $200 visit fee. </s></s> After surgery, my wife was not doing too well -- she was in a lot of pain.  I bought these magnetic wristbands that align with the body's natural vibrations to reduce the pain, and sure enough, a few days later the pain subsided!  Thank you magic wristbands!

source_article: Our soccer team was losing until I bought new shoes. We have not lost a game since I got my lucky shoes! </s></s> At soccer practice, Willeidy tells Aida, "Pace's soccer team was losing until I bought new shoes. We have not lost a game since I got my lucky shoes!"

cbr: People generally like to walk on the beach. Beaches have sand. Therefore, having sand floors in homes would be a great idea!
source_article: People like to walk on the beach. Beaches have sand. We should put sand on the floor in our living room. </s></s> People generally like to walk on the beach. Beaches have sand. Therefore, having sand floors in homes would be a great idea!

cbr: “You can’t give me a C. I’m an A student!”
source_article: You can't give me a C! I'm an A student, a C is just wrong! </s></s> “You can’t give me a C. I’m an A student!”

cbr: Marie notices that many of her friends have started eating a low-carb diet and drinking protein shakes. Marie decides that this must be the healthy way to eat, so she joins them.
source_article: Marie notices that many of her friends have started eating a low-carb diet and drinking protein shakes. Marie decides that if this many friends are eating this way that this must be the healthy way to eat so she joins them. This is an example of which logical fallacy? </s></s> Marie notices that many of her friends have started eating a low-carb diet and drinking protein shakes. Marie decides that this must be the healthy way to eat, so she joins them.

cbr: "Trump won't release his tax returns and prove he's clean, therefore he must have something to hide."
source_article: Congressman Darell Issa calls White House Spokesperson Jay Carney a "paid liar." </s></s> "Trump won't release his tax returns and prove he's clean, therefore he must have something to hide."

cbr: I don't know about you, but I would never take the word of a woman who never finished school.
source_article:
If I have cable, then I have seen a naked lady.
I don’t have cable.
Therefore, I have never seen a naked lady. </s></s> I don't know about you, but I would never take the word of a woman who never finished school.

cbr: "Terrorists must not be given the chance to invade our beloved country."
source_article: If the country is ever going to be safe from terrorists we have to close the borders. </s></s> "Terrorists must not be given the chance to invade our beloved country."

cbr: I hope I presented my argument clearly.  Now, my opponent will attempt to refute my argument by his own fallacious, incoherent, illogical version of history.
source_article: In the debate at Harvard, one of the Harvard team’s debaters rebutted Samantha Booke’s argument that Henry David Thoreau, a Harvard graduate, proposed civil disobedience as a means to protest unjust laws. The Harvard debater rebutted her by saying, “Thoreau could never know that Adolph Hitler would agree with him.” A BETTER rebuttal would have been to… </s></s> I hope I presented my argument clearly.  Now, my opponent will attempt to refute my argument by his own fallacious, incoherent, illogical version of history.

cbr: Believing that "runs" occur to statistically independent phenomena such as roulette wheel spins.
source_article: Believing that "runs" occur to statistically independent phenomena such as routine wheel spirits. </s></s> Believing that "runs" occur to statistically independent phenomena such as roulette wheel spins.

cbr: “I know the exam is graded based on performance, but you should give me an A. My cat has been sick, my car broke down, and I’ve had a cold, so it was really hard for me to study!” Demanded Aun.
source_article: If you write to Mrs. Roth and tell her: "Mrs Roth, I know I haven't done any of the assignments, but I need a C anyway because I'm asking nicely and I'm good person, and I'm going to get in trouble if you don't." </s></s> “I know the exam is graded based on performance, but you should give me an A. My cat has been sick, my car broke down, and I’ve had a cold, so it was really hard for me to study!” Demanded Aun.

cbr:
Charlie: Illegal posting and sharing of songs online is crippling the music industry.
Bob: You couldn’t be more wrong; the music industry is doing just fine. I can’t believe you think the government should be allowed to regulate what I share with my “friends.” No one wants a world where I can’t loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers.
source_article:
Charlie: Illegal posting and sharing of songs online is crippling the music industry.
Bob: You couldn't be more wrong; the music industry is doing just fine.  I can't believe you think the government should be allowed to regulate what I share with my "friends."  No one wants a world where I can't loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers. </s></s> Charlie: Illegal posting and sharing of songs online is crippling the music industry.
Bob: You couldn’t be more wrong; the music industry is doing just fine. I can’t believe you think the government should be allowed to regulate what I share with my “friends.” No one wants a world where I can’t loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers.

cbr: All teachers drink coffee and teachers are people; therefore, all people drink coffee.
source_article: People either like coffee or hate it. </s></s> All teachers drink coffee and teachers are people; therefore, all people drink coffee.

cbr: The economy continues to grow as the number of likes on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked.
source_article: “The economy has improved greatly because of the new president.” </s></s> The economy continues to grow as the number of likes on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked.

cbr: Michael Jackson, Kurt Cobain, and Jimi Hendrix were rock stars who died young. Therefore, if you become a rock star, don’t expect to live a long life.
source_article: Michael is part of the Jackson Five.  Without Tito and company, he will never make it. </s></s> Michael Jackson, Kurt Cobain, and Jimi Hendrix were rock stars who died young. Therefore, if you become a rock star, don’t expect to live a long life.

cbr: “I know the exam is graded based on performance, but you should give me an A. My cat has been sick, my car broke down, and I’ve had a cold, so it was really hard for me to study!” Demanded Aun.
source_article: Sarah wakes up one morning to find that she has just slept through her anatomy test. She emails her teacher and asks if she can make up the test. Sarah states that she deserves to take it over because she didn't sleep well because her boyfriend just broke up with her, her dog is sick and she stained her favorite dress. What fallacy is this? </s></s> “I know the exam is graded based on performance, but you should give me an A. My cat has been sick, my car broke down, and I’ve had a cold, so it was really hard for me to study!” Demanded Aun.

cbr: Cell phones, high-tech devices that cause severe distractions and cyberbullying should be banned in schools.
source_article: "The research I found on cell phone use in the classroom suggests that students can be distracted when they have access to texting. This leads me to believe that all high school students should not be allowed to have their phones on them at school anytime. </s></s> Cell phones, high-tech devices that cause severe distractions and cyberbullying should be banned in schools.

cbr: 'Our family has always been farmers, so we should always be farmers'' is an example of which logical fallacy?
source_article:
Dave: For five generations, the men in our family went to Stanford and became doctors, while the women got married and raised children.  Therefore, it is my duty to become a doctor.
Kaitlin: Do you want to become a doctor?
Dave: It doesn’t matter -- it is our family tradition.  Who am I to break it?
 </s></s> 'Our family has always been farmers, so we should always be farmers'' is an example of which logical fallacy?

cbr: You ask your mother if you can go to the mall with your friends. She says "no". You ask why? She says, "because I'm the mom and I say so". This is an example of which logical fallacy?
source_article:
Mom: Watching TV that close will make you go blind, so move back!
Jonny: That is B.S., Mom. Sorry, I am not moving.
 </s></s> You ask your mother if you can go to the mall with your friends. She says "no". You ask why? She says, "because I'm the mom and I say so". This is an example of which logical fallacy?

cbr: All women are bad drivers.
source_article: A driver with a New York license plate cuts you off in traffic. You decide that all New York drivers are terrible drivers. </s></s> All women are bad drivers.

cbr: Every time that rooster crows, the sun comes up. The rooster must control the sun.
source_article: The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise. </s></s> Every time that rooster crows, the sun comes up. The rooster must control the sun.

cbr: The statement "you are not really an American if you are vegetarian" is an example of which fallacy?
source_article: If someone told you, "Why should we be worrying about how the government treats Native people, when people in our city can't get a job?" what logical fallacy are they using? </s></s> The statement "you are not really an American if you are vegetarian" is an example of which fallacy?

cbr: Joseph can’t be class president, he’s poor!”
source_article: The new vice president has never gone to public school, so he can never connect to the middle and lower class. </s></s> Joseph can’t be class president, he’s poor!”

source_article: Distracting and dangerous mobile devices should be banned from use in vehicles. </s></s> Cell phones, high-tech devices that cause severe distractions and cyberbullying should be banned in schools.

cbr: “Everyone else is doing it, so should you”.
source_article: This technique uses the logic: Everyone else is doing it, you should too! </s></s> “Everyone else is doing it, so should you”.

Pete: What are you going to do about it?
David: Vandalize, loot, and perhaps a little arson.
 </s></s> The number of off-leash dogs I've seen in Livingston is completely unacceptable. Let's make our streets safe again by addressing this dog problem, before our city becomes a haven for criminals.

source_article: That song is stupid because I don't know that musician. </s></s> I've never knowingly listened to a Neil Young record all the way through because they all sound like someone strangling a cat (don't they?).

cbr: If you are open to it, love will find you.
source_article: "You'll make the right decision because you have something that not many people do: you have heart."? </s></s> If you are open to it, love will find you.

cbr: Billy - "Spanish is easy." Bobby - "Don't listen to Billy; he failed Spanish class last year. "
source_article: Student: Hey, Professor Moore, we shouldn't have to read this book by Freud. Everyone knows he used cocaine. </s></s> Billy - "Spanish is easy." Bobby - "Don't listen to Billy; he failed Spanish class last year. "

cbr: “Live with me or live on the streets”
source_article: Give me liberty or give me death </s></s> “Live with me or live on the streets”

cbr: Won't you give the abandoned puppy a home?
source_article: "A dog would be a great addition to our family. Think about how wonderful it would be to come home to a happy, excited, loving dog?" This is an example of which persuasive technique? </s></s> Won't you give the abandoned puppy a home?

cbr: A mother tells her children not to leave the yard because there might be wild animals in the woods.
source_article: Only fools are out in public right now. Careful people are staying home. </s></s> A mother tells her children not to leave the yard because there might be wild animals in the woods.

cbr: There are so many experiences in the human realm that are wonderful. Sexual intimacy between two willing adults who love each other is wonderful. A therapist helping a client is wonderful. When the relationship between a therapist and client is so deep that it could be characterized as love, it's wonderful. When all these acts become part of one process between two people, it must be exceptionally wonderful. How could anyone condemn such a wonderfully human process as unethical?
source_article: Confession is good for the soul. </s></s> There are so many experiences in the human realm that are wonderful. Sexual intimacy between two willing adults who love each other is wonderful. A therapist helping a client is wonderful. When the relationship between a therapist and client is so deep that it could be characterized as love, it's wonderful. When all these acts become part of one process between two people, it must be exceptionally wonderful. How could anyone condemn such a wonderfully human process as unethical?

source_article: Although we have proven that the moon is not made of spare ribs, we have not proven that its core cannot be filled with them; therefore, the moon’s core is filled with spare ribs. </s></s> Although we have proven that the moon is not made of short ribs, we have not proven that its core cannot be filled with them; therefore, the moon’s core is filled with short ribs.

cbr: If we allow euthanasia, the next thing you know, murder will be legal.

Even if the former can be justified, the latter clearly cannot. Hence, it is better that the first step (legalizing voluntary euthanasia) not be taken so as to prevent a slide into non-volunteer euthanasia. </s></s> If we allow euthanasia, the next thing you know, murder will be legal.

source_article: There are so many experiences in the human realm that are wonderful. Sexual intimacy between two willing adults who love each other is wonderful. When all these acts become part of one process between two people, it must be exceptionally wonderful. cbr: The research and reasoning that supposedly supports (or that supposedly discredits) this intervention are a joke. The researchers are people who are not methodologically sophisticated and there have been rumors--I have no idea whether they're true or not--that they faked some of the data. The advocates (or opponents) of this intervention are the worst kind of sloppy thinkers. They are fanatical adherents who already have their minds made up; they've become true believers in their cause. They make arguments only a stupid person would accept, and mistakes in reasoning that would make an undergrad psych major blush. These are not the kind of people who deserve to be taken seriously.
source_article: Radio talk show host, on learning that an association of critical thinking professors had suggested his show as a source of fallacious reasoning: “Who are these people? They talk to maybe 30 people at a time. I talk to 5 million people every day. They could not begin to do what I do. They are just gnats flying around getting in the way.” </s></s> The research and reasoning that supposedly supports (or that supposedly discredits) this intervention are a joke. The researchers are people who are not methodologically sophisticated and there have been rumors--I have no idea whether they're true or not--that they faked some of the data. The advocates (or opponents) of this intervention are the worst kind of sloppy thinkers. They are fanatical adherents who already have their minds made up; they've become true believers in their cause. They make arguments only a stupid person would accept, and mistakes in reasoning that would make an undergrad psych major blush. These are not the kind of people who deserve to be taken seriously.

source_article: "University of Virginia professor [Charlotte] Patterson, considered a leading researcher in the field, says she has reviewed 22 studies involving offspring of gays ranging from toddlers to adults. She found none convincing [sic] that the children had suffered or were more than normally inclined to be gay. [...] Conservatives discredit Patterson by pointing out that she is an acknowledged lesbian, with a presumed ideological interest in the subject she studies." </s></s> A recent study found that there are plenty of scientists who disagree with the consensus position on this phenomenon.

cbr: People who buy stocks are no different from people who bet on horse racing. They both risk their money with little chance of making a big profit.
source_article:
Joe and Sam are at the race track betting on horses. Joe: "You see that horse over there? He lost his last four races. I'm going to bet on him."
Sam: "Why? I think he will probably lose."
Joe: "No way, Sam. I looked up the horse's stats and he has won half his races in the past two years. Since he has lost three of his last four races, he'll have to win this race. So I'm betting the farm on him."
Sam: "Are you sure?"
Joe: "Of course I'm sure. That pony is due, man...he's due!" </s></s> People who buy stocks are no different from people who bet on horse racing. They both risk their money with little chance of making a big profit.

cbr: If voluntary euthanasia were to be legalized it would prove impossible to avoid the legislation, or, at least, toleration, of non-voluntary euthanasia. Even if the former can be justified, the latter clearly cannot. Hence, it is better that the first step (legalizing voluntary euthanasia) not be taken so as to prevent a slide into non-volunteer euthanasia.
source_article: "A person apparently hopelessly ill may be allowed to take his own life. Then he may be permitted to deputize others to do it for him should he no longer be able to act. The judgment of others then becomes the ruling factor. Already at this point euthanasia is not personal and voluntary, for others are acting on behalf of the patient as they see fit. This may well incline them to act on behalf of other patients who have not authorized them to exercise their judgment. It is only a short step, then, from voluntary euthanasia (self-inflicted or authorized), to directed euthanasia administered to a patient who has given no authorization, to involuntary euthanasia conducted as a part of a social policy." </s></s> If voluntary euthanasia were to be legalized it would prove impossible to avoid the legislation, or, at least, toleration, of non-voluntary euthanasia. Even if the former can be justified, the latter clearly cannot. Hence, it is better that the first step (legalizing voluntary euthanasia) not be taken so as to prevent a slide into non-volunteer euthanasia.

source_article:

Some in Dubai called foul, including one writer who wants to remind Britons that their own country has a dark side. After all, what to think of a country in which one-fifth of the population lives in poverty? </s></s> Speaker 1: I really think we need to do something about the rising levels of poverty and homelessness in our country.
Speaker 2: Why are you worried about poverty? Look how many children we abort every day.

cbr: I am voting for Smith for President because the rest of my family is voting for him.

cbr: My opponent raises a good point, but can we really trust him? I mean he moved to this town only two years ago and everyone knows that his wife left him.
source_article: My opponent in this election claims to have the best interests of our community at heart. However, he is separated from his family. Isn’t family the basic unit of society? How can we entrust the concerns of the community to someone who was not able to keep his family together? </s></s> My opponent raises a good point, but can we really trust him? I mean he moved to this town only two years ago and everyone knows that his wife left him.

source_article: "Advocates of legalized abortion predicted it would solve our social problems. Instead, this destruction of one-fourth of a generation has left a more violent society in its wake: Child abuse has exploded, from 167,000 estimated cases in 1973 to 2.4 million in 1989, according to the National Center of Child Abuse and Neglect - a 1,400% increase. Teen suicide, among non-aborted and thus presumably "wanted" children, has doubled. Violent crime has more than doubled." </s></s> Violence among teens has risen the last five years. cbr: "A person apparently hopelessly ill may be allowed to take his own life. Then he may be permitted to deputize others to do it for him should he no longer be able to act. The judgment of others then becomes the ruling factor. Already at this point euthanasia is not personal and voluntary, for others are acting on behalf of the patient as they see fit. This may well incline them to act on behalf of other patients who have not authorized them to exercise their judgment. It is only a short step, then, from voluntary euthanasia (self-inflicted or authorized), to directed euthanasia administered to a patient who has given no authorization, to involuntary euthanasia conducted as a part of a social policy."
source_article: Only a mentally ill person would kill someone, so anyone who kills someone is automatically mentally ill. </s></s> "A person apparently hopelessly ill may be allowed to take his own life. Then he may be permitted to deputize others to do it for him should he no longer be able to act. The judgment of others then becomes the ruling factor. Already at this point euthanasia is not personal and voluntary, for others are acting on behalf of the patient as they see fit. This may well incline them to act on behalf of other patients who have not authorized them to exercise their judgment. It is only a short step, then, from voluntary euthanasia (self-inflicted or authorized), to directed euthanasia administered to a patient who has given no authorization, to involuntary euthanasia conducted as a part of a social policy."

cbr: Medical expenses for the elderly continue to rise. If you don't buy long-term health insurance now, you probably won't be able to qualify once you're older. Sure, the insurance policy is a little expensive, but it's worth spending the money today so you don't go bankrupt in the future, becoming a burden to your family.
source_article: Without this additional insurance, you could find yourself broke and homeless. </s></s> Medical expenses for the elderly continue to rise. If you don't buy long-term health insurance now, you probably won't be able to qualify once you're older. Sure, the insurance policy is a little expensive, but it's worth spending the money today so you don't go bankrupt in the future, becoming a burden to your family.

cbr: “My wife wants to talk about cleaning out the garage, so I asked her what she wants to do with our patio furniture. Now she’s shopping for new patio furniture and not asking me about the garage.”
source_article:
Bill and Jill are arguing about cleaning out their closets: 
Jill: "We should clean out the closets. They are getting a bit messy." 
Bill: "Why, we just went through those closets last year. Do we have to clean them out everyday?" 
Jill: "I never said anything about cleaning them out every day. You just want too keep all your junk forever, which is just ridiculous." </s></s> “My wife wants to talk about cleaning out the garage, so I asked her what she wants to do with our patio furniture. Now she’s shopping for new patio furniture and not asking me about the garage.”

cbr: "Terrorists must not be given the chance to invade our beloved country."
source_article: "I will end this war in Iraq responsibly, and finish the fight against al Qaeda and the Taliban in Afghanistan. I will rebuild our military to meet future conflicts. But I will also renew the tough, direct diplomacy that can prevent Iran from obtaining nuclear weapons and curb Russian aggression. I will build new partnerships to defeat the threats of the 21st century: terrorism and nuclear proliferation; poverty and genocide; climate change and disease. And I will restore our moral standing, so that America is once again that last, best hope for all who are called to the cause of freedom, who long for lives of peace, and who yearn for a better future."  Which appeal is the primary appeal used in this quote? </s></s> "Terrorists must not be given the chance to invade our beloved country."

cbr: "Senator Jones says that we should not fund the attack submarine program. I disagree entirely. I can't understand why he wants to leave us defenseless like that."
source_article: Senator Lewis says we should not fund the missile attack program. I disagree. I can't understand why he wants to leave us defenseless like that."

Some pets are cats.
Therefore, some pets are not animals.
source_article:
An increasing number of people are keeping ferrets as pets, so they must make wonderful companion animals. </s></s> All cats are animals.
Some pets are cats.
Therefore, some pets are not animals.

Hydrogen is not wet.  Oxygen is not wet.  Therefore, water (H2O) is not wet.

The shopping is a red herring, since the original issue was
video games. 
 </s></s> Distracting your audience from the original issue by introducing an irrelevant topic.

cbr:
Person 1: You’re either for the war or against the troops.

Person 2: Actually, I do not want our troops sent into a dangerous war.
source_article:
Bert: I've been learning about the Second World War lately. I found that America provoked Japan into attacking Pearl Harbor. I don't think that was the right thing to do.
Jenny: Oh, so you are now taking the side of Axis? Do you think Germany and Japan were right to do what they did? </s></s> Person 1: You’re either for the war or against the troops.

Person 2: Actually, I do not want our troops sent into a dangerous war.

cbr: My fridge isn't working. I should probably finish that book I've been reading.
source_article: I would have done my homework, but my refrigerator stopped working. </s></s> My fridge isn't working. I should probably finish that book I've been reading.

cbr: If I eat fast food for dinner, then I have a stomach ache in the evening. I had a stomach ache this evening. Therefore I ate fast food for dinner.
source_article: I ate Oreos, and then I was sick the next day. It must have been the Oreos that caused my sickness. </s></s> If I eat fast food for dinner, then I have a stomach ache in the evening. I had a stomach ache this evening. Therefore I ate fast food for dinner.

What logical fallacy is used in the statement above? </s></s> I drank bottled water and now I am sick, so the water must have made me sick.

cbr:
Ted: Biological evolution is both a theory and a fact.

Edwin: That is ridiculous!  How can you possibly be absolutely certain that we evolved from pond scum!

Ted: Actually, that is a gross misrepresentation of my assertion.  I never claimed we evolved from pond scum.  Unlike math and logic, science is based on empirical evidence and, therefore, a scientific fact is something that is confirmed to such a degree that it would be perverse to withhold provisional consent.  The empirical evidence for the fact that biological evolution does occur falls into this category.

Unlike math and logic, science is based on empirical evidence and, therefore, a scientific fact is something that is confirmed to such a degree that it would be perverse to withhold provisional consent.  The empirical evidence for the fact that biological evolution does occur falls into this category.

cbr: "You asked me why the unemployment rate has increased once more, but I'm going to tell you what has an even worse effect on morale in this country."
source_article:
JOHN F. KENNEDY: I'm not satisfied when the United States had last year the lowest rate of economic growth of any major industrialized society in the world… (from opening statement)
RICHARD NIXON: We heard tonight, for example, the statement made that our growth in national product last year was the lowest of any industrial nation in the world. Now last year, of course, was 1958. That happened to be a recession year. But when we look at the growth of G.N.P. this year, a year of recovery, we find that it's six and nine-tenths per cent and one of the highest in the world today… (from opening statement)
September 26, 1960
Chicago, Illinois

What logical fallacy does Kennedy use? </s></s> "You asked me why the unemployment rate has increased once more, but I'm going to tell you what has an even worse effect on morale in this country."

cbr: People who buy stocks are no different from people who bet on horse racing. They both risk their money with little chance of making a big profit.
source_article:
Joe and Sam are at the race track betting on horses. Joe: "You see that horse over there? He lost his last four races. I'm going to bet on him."
Sam: "Why? I think he will probably lose."
Joe: "No way, Sam. I looked up the horse's stats and he has won half his races in the past two years. Since he has lost three of his last four races, he'll have to win this race. So I'm betting the farm on him."
Sam: "Are you sure?"
Joe: "Of course I'm sure. That pony is due, man...he's due!" </s></s> People who buy stocks are no different from people who bet on horse racing. They both risk their money with little chance of making a big profit.

cbr: There are so many experiences in the human realm that are wonderful. Sexual intimacy between two willing adults who love each other is wonderful. A therapist helping a client is wonderful. When all these acts become part of one process between two people, it must be exceptionally wonderful. How could anyone condemn such a wonderfully human process as unethical?
