cbr: I'm hardly prepared to listen to the arguments of an ignorant moron like you.
source_article:
Karen: I am sorry, but if you think man used to ride dinosaurs, then you are obviously not very well educated.
Kent:  First of all, I hold a PhD in creation science, so I am well-educated.  Second of all, your ad hominem attack shows that you are wrong, and man did use to ride dinosaurs.
Karen:  Getting your PhD in a couple of months, from a “college” in a trailer park, is not being well-educated.  My fallacy in no way is evidence for man riding on dinosaurs, and despite what you may think, the Flintstone’s was not a documentary!
 </s></s> I'm hardly prepared to listen to the arguments of an ignorant moron like you.

cbr:

Biology teacher: The theory of evolution states that all species evolve, even humans.
Student: I can't accept that humans came from bugs.
Profesor de biología: la teoría de la evolución afirma que todas las especies evolucionan, incluso los humanos.
Estudiante: No puedo aceptar que los humanos provengan de insectos. </s></s> Scientist: Evolution explains how animals developed, adapted and diversified over millions of years.
Opponent: If we evolved from monkeys, why are there still monkeys? And why don't we have three arms? Wouldn't that give me a competitive advantage?

cbr: In the 6 years that I have been practicing my new and improved brand of cognitive-humanistic-dynamic-behavioral-deconstructive-metaregressive-deontological psychotherapy (now with biofeedback!), which I developed, there has not been one published study showing that it fails to work or that it has ever harmed a patient. It is clearly one of the safest and most effective interventions ever devised.
source_article: In the four years that I have been marketing my new and improved brand of past-life regressive biocognitive astral-projective hyperaffective-hypnotic-teleological-metatherapy (buy ten sessions and the next one is free!), not one person has proved it is worthless or that I am unethical for providing a therapy I just made up one day when I realized that no one was referring clients to me anymore. That makes clear what a worthwhile therapy this is and how exceptionally ethical I am to provide it. </s></s> In the 6 years that I have been practicing my new and improved brand of cognitive-humanistic-dynamic-behavioral-deconstructive-metaregressive-deontological psychotherapy (now with biofeedback!), which I developed, there has not been one published study showing that it fails to work or that it has ever harmed a patient. cbr: Jimmy Swaggart argued strongly against sexual immorality, yet while married, he has had several affairs with prostitutes; therefore, sexual immorality is acceptable.
source_article:
My political candidate gives 10% of his income to the needy, goes to church every Sunday, and volunteers one day a week at a homeless shelter. Therefore, he is honest and morally straight.
Explanation: What information was left out of the example is that this same candidate gives 10% of his income to needy prostitutes in exchange for services, goes to the bar every Sunday after church (and sometimes before), and only works at the homeless shelter to get clients for his drug dealing business. </s></s> Jimmy Swaggart argued strongly against sexual immorality, yet while married, he has had several affairs with prostitutes; therefore, sexual immorality is acceptable.

cbr: The research and reasoning that supposedly supports (or that supposedly discredits) this intervention are a joke. The researchers are people who are not methodologically sophisticated and there have been rumors--I have no idea whether they're true or not--that they faked some of the data. The advocates (or opponents) of this intervention are the worst kind of sloppy thinkers. They are fanatical adherents who already have their minds made up; they've become true believers in their cause. They make arguments only a stupid person would accept, and mistakes in reasoning that would make an undergrad psych major blush. These are not the kind of people who deserve to be taken seriously.
source_article: Some of you have objected to the ethics of my clinic's buying those new test batteries. You claim that the new tests are unreliable, have no published norms, have never demonstrated validity, cannot be used by clients who are physically disabled, have been condemned as bogus by every major scientific organization, and were developed and sold by my brother-in-law, who unfortunately cannot be with us today due to a misunderstanding with his overly controlling and rigidly judgmental parole officer. What you have apparently failed to appreciate, however, is that these new tests are much easier to learn, can be administered and scored in a fraction of the time required by the old tests, and were so inexpensive compared to the old tests that I'll be able to give you each a bonus at the end of the month. </s></s> The research and reasoning that supposedly supports (or that supposedly discredits) this intervention are a joke. The researchers are people who are not methodologically sophisticated and there have been rumors--I have no idea whether they're true or not--that they faked some of the data. The advocates (or opponents) of this intervention are the worst kind of sloppy thinkers. They are fanatical adherents who already have their minds made up; they've become true believers in their cause. They make arguments only a stupid person would accept, and mistakes in reasoning that would make an undergrad psych major blush. These are not the kind of people who deserve to be taken seriously.

cbr: Angus declares that Scotsmen do not put sugar on their porridge, to which Lachlan points out that he is a Scotsman and puts sugar on his porridge. Furious, like a true Scot, Angus yells that no true Scotsman sugars his porridge.
source_article:
Andy states that a Scotsman would never put sugar on his porridge. Dougal replies that he is a Scotsman and he does put sugar on his porridge. Andy counters that no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge.

Andy thus changes the terms of the argument, implying that Dougal is not a "true" Scotsman in order to support his own position. </s></s> Angus declares that Scotsmen do not put sugar on their porridge, to which Lachlan points out that he is a Scotsman and puts sugar on his porridge. Furious, like a true Scot, Angus yells that no true Scotsman sugars his porridge.

cbr: We, the people, are going to work together to achieve justice, unity, and integrity.
source_article: "I am not unmindful that some of you have come here out of great trials and tribulations. Some of you have come fresh from narrow jail cells. And some of you have come from areas where your quest -- quest for freedom left you battered by the storms of persecution and staggered by the winds of police brutality. You have been the veterans of creative suffering. Continue to work with the faith that unearned suffering is redemptive. Go back to Mississippi, go back to Alabama, go back to South Carolina, go back to Georgia, go back to Louisiana, go back to the slums and ghettos of our northern cities, knowing that somehow this situation can and will be changed."  Which appeal is the primary appeal used in this quote? </s></s> We, the people, are going to work together to achieve justice, unity, and integrity.

After all, because of her excellent memory, she got through high school without studying. cbr: "A person apparently hopelessly ill may be allowed to take his own life. Then he may be permitted to deputize others to do it for him should he no longer be able to act. The judgment of others then becomes the ruling factor. Already at this point euthanasia is not personal and voluntary, for others are acting on behalf of the patient as they see fit. This may well incline them to act on behalf of other patients who have not authorized them to exercise their judgment. It is only a short step, then, from voluntary euthanasia (self-inflicted or authorized), to directed euthanasia administered to a patient who has given no authorization, to involuntary euthanasia conducted as a part of a social policy."
source_article: If you choose not to administer triple antibiotic coverage for this patient with severe and extensive burns, you will be held responsible for any infectious complications that might eventually arise. </s></s> "A person apparently hopelessly ill may be allowed to take his own life. Then he may be permitted to deputize others to do it for him should he no longer be able to act. The judgment of others then becomes the ruling factor. Already at this point euthanasia is not personal and voluntary, for others are acting on behalf of the patient as they see fit. This may well incline them to act on behalf of other patients who have not authorized them to exercise their judgment. It is only a short step, then, from voluntary euthanasia (self-inflicted or authorized), to directed euthanasia administered to a patient who has given no authorization, to involuntary euthanasia conducted as a part of a social policy."

source_article: "Men are human. Mary is a human. Therefore, Mary is a man." </s></s> If Hunter was human, he would be mortal. Hunter is mortal. Therefore, Hunter is a human.

Ann: "You're ugly and poor!" </s></s> That answer you just gave cannot be right because you are always so rude.

cbr: This fallacy assumes something is true (or right, or good) because other people agree with it.
source_article: claiming that an idea or belief is true simply because it is what most people believe </s></s> This fallacy assumes something is true (or right, or good) because other people agree with it.

cbr: James' mom is concerned when she finds out that he skipped class one day. She tells him that she is concerned that since he skipped one class, he will start skipping more frequently. Then he will drop out altogether, never graduate or get into college, and end up unemployed and living at home for the rest of his life. What type of fallacy has James' mom committed?
source_article: The mother of a young child tells him to go to bed, and he begins to ask questions, say that he is hungry, or say that he needs to go to the bathroom-all to avoid bed and distract mom. </s></s> James' mom is concerned when she finds out that he skipped class one day. She tells him that she is concerned that since he skipped one class, he will start skipping more frequently. Then he will drop out altogether, never graduate or get into college, and end up unemployed and living at home for the rest of his life. What type of fallacy has James' mom committed?

cbr: Sarah loves to wear running shoes, all girls must like to run.
source_article: She's wearing red shoes. Her favorite color must be red. </s></s> Sarah loves to wear running shoes, all girls must like to run.

cbr: SM 3: Polls concerning global warming
source_article:
Tasha is studying polar and tropical climates on Earth. She learned the following:
• Tropical climates: Summer and winter temperatures are similar.
• Polar climates: Summer temperature is much higher than winter temperature.
Tasha wonders why the tropical climate has the same temperature year round, but the polar climate temperature differs greatly.
Which of these explains the reason for this difference? </s></s> SM 3: Polls concerning global warming

cbr: If you are open to it, love will find you.
source_article: The greatest thing that we can do is to love each other. Love is better than any other emotion. </s></s> If you are open to it, love will find you.

That means that he wants to raise taxes for the middle class. </s></s> My opponent in this debate wants all of you to increase taxes for a recycling program, but his own company has been fined over a dozen times for pollution and environmental damage.

cbr: Every time that rooster crows, the sun comes up. The rooster must control the sun.
source_article: Every time that rooster crows, the sun comes up. That rooster must be very powerful and important! </s></s> Every time that rooster crows, the sun comes up. The rooster must control the sun.

cbr: "If you never gave money to charity, then you must be a greedy millionaire." What is this?
source_article: The Church used to claim that giving 10% of your income to the Church will free a child’s soul from Limbo into Heaven, so clearly giving money to the Church is a scam! </s></s> "If you never gave money to charity, then you must be a greedy millionaire." What is this?

cbr: Saying that because one finds something difficult to understand, therefore it's not true
source_article:
"'What about Red Herring, ma'am?''

"'I'm not sure. Is Red Herring a red herring? Or is it the fact that we're meant to think Red Herring is a red herring that is actually the red herring?'

"'Or perhaps the fact you're meant to think Red Herring isn't a red herring is what makes Red Herring a red herring after all.'

"'We're talking serious metaherrings here.'"  </s></s> Saying that because one finds something difficult to understand, therefore it's not true

cbr: My grandmother smoked for 80 years and died at 100. Obviously, smoking isn’t harmful.
source_article: Because doctors smoke it must be a healthy choice. </s></s> My grandmother smoked for 80 years and died at 100. Obviously, smoking isn’t harmful.

cbr: The new iPhone comes out this weekend! If you don't get it, you're not cool!
source_article: "You should run right out and purchase the newest iPhone 22 because you will literally be the only one who doesn't own one!" This is an example of what type of persuasive technique? </s></s> The new iPhone comes out this weekend! If you don't get it, you're not cool!

cbr: "everybody's doing it, so it must be a good thing to do."
source_article: Everyone who gets a college degree is better off.  All people who are better off as a result of getting a degree are good to have conversations with.  Therefore, everyone who gets a college degree is a good person to have a conversation with. </s></s> "everybody's doing it, so it must be a good thing to do."

cbr: Nike's are great because they're awesome.
source_article: Don't be the only one not wearing Nike! </s></s> Nike's are great because they're awesome.

cbr: The car was built with cheap parts, so it only goes to show that the car will fall apart.
source_article: My car broke down yesterday. Cars are worthless. </s></s> The car was built with cheap parts, so it only goes to show that the car will fall apart.

cbr: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the knack of talking effectively to the people.
source_article: Because Martin Sheen played the president on television, he'd probably make a great president in real life. </s></s> President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the knack of talking effectively to the people.

cbr: I was just on the phone with a Southerner, and I could barely keep up! All Southerners talk fast.
source_article: Southerners talk fast. I was just on the phone with one, and I could barely keep up! </s></s> I was just on the phone with a Southerner, and I could barely keep up! All Southerners talk fast.

source_article: IBM is a reputable organization, so all of its employees must be reputable. </s></s> Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.

cbr: If it was raining outside, it would be dark. It’s dark outside, so it must be raining.
source_article: It was a rainy day in Harvard Square, so the foot traffic through the atrium from Mass Ave to Mount Auburn Street was heavier than it might have been if the sun were out. A lot of people were carrying umbrellas, which most of them furled inside. I had always thought that Cambridge, in the vicinity of Harvard, might have had the most umbrellas per capita of any place in the world. People used them when it snowed. In my childhood, in Laramie, Wyoming, we used to think people who carried umbrellas were sissies. </s></s> If it was raining outside, it would be dark. It’s dark outside, so it must be raining.

cbr: This type of propaganda implies that since EVERYONE else is buying a product, so should you!
source_article: “[Everyone else is buying it, so you should too!]” </s></s> This type of propaganda implies that since EVERYONE else is buying a product, so should you!

cbr: If voluntary euthanasia were to be legalized it would prove impossible to avoid the legislation, or, at least, toleration, of non-voluntary euthanasia. Even if the former can be justified, the latter clearly cannot. Hence, it is better that the first step (legalizing voluntary euthanasia) not be taken so as to prevent a slide into non-volunteer euthanasia.

Regime vs. government

Hence, it is better that the first step (legalizing voluntary euthanasia) not be taken so as to prevent a slide into non-volunteer euthanasia.

cbr:
Parent: I really don’t want you to smoke pot. It’s still illegal, and could get you into trouble.

Child: Didn’t you smoke pot when you were my age? You must not think it’s a big deal.

cbr: During the early 2000s, the search for a cause of autism led to vaccines, though no scientific link has been found between the administration of vaccines and the onset of autism. The time that children are vaccinated and the time they're diagnosed do closely correlate, however, leading upset parents to assign blame to the immunizations, for lack of a better explanation.

cbr: If we ban Hummers because they are bad for the environment eventually the government will ban all cars, so we should not ban Hummers.
source_article: Hybrid cars are like solar power, full of promise but too expensive. We’ll never be able to build affordable hybrid cars. </s></s> If we ban Hummers because they are bad for the environment eventually the government will ban all cars, so we should not ban Hummers.

source_article: "Guys are messy and unclean, but are really hard workers." is an example of ... </s></s> "Men are human. Mary is a human. Therefore, Mary is a man."

cbr: That song is stupid because I don't know that musician.
source_article: I've never knowingly listened to a Neil Young record all the way through because they all sound like someone strangling a cat (don't they?). </s></s> That song is stupid because I don't know that musician.

cbr: I don't believe in God. One reason is that I think he is evil. And by the way, there is no such thing as "evil;" it is just our evaluation of what we believe is wrong.

And by the way, there is no such thing as "evil;" it is just our evaluation of what we believe is wrong.

What logic fallacy does this represent? </s></s> “Richard Dawkins, an evolutionary biologist and perhaps the foremost expert in the field, says that evolution is true. Therefore, I believe it's true.”

source_article: "Terrorists must not be given the chance to invade our beloved country." </s></s> If the country is ever going to be safe from terrorists we have to close the borders.

cbr:
TOPIC: Should people let their cats go outside?

TOPIC: Should people let their cats go outside?
DEBATE: "People should let their cats go outside. Going outside gives cats more exercise."
"But if you let cats go outside, then they'll hunt all the birds in the neighborhood. If you let them hunt all the birds, then robins will go extinct." </s></s> TOPIC: Should people let their cats go outside?
DEBATE: "People should let their cats go outside. Going outside gives cats more exercise."
"What do you know? You've never even had a pet cat before!"

source_article: The phrase "Ninety percent of all people surveyed said that McDonalds is better than Burger King, so we can confidently say we are the best." represents which fallacy? </s></s> the phrase "Ninety percent of all people surveyed said that McDonalds is better than Burger King so it must be true."  represents which fallacy?

source_article: If you eat that cookie tonight, you'll eat ten tomorrow, and by this time next year, you'll be eating 1 million cookies a day. </s></s> If you break your diet and have one cookie tonight, you will just want to eat 10 cookies tomorrow, and before you know it, you will have gained back the 15 pounds you lost.

source_article: Colin Closet asserts that if we allow same-sex couples to marry, then the next thing we know we'll be allowing people to marry their parents, their cars and even monkeys. </s></s> “If we allow gay people to get married, then the next thing you know people will be wanting to marry their pets!”

cbr: Not believing in the literal resurrection of Jesus because the Bible has errors and contradictions, is like denying that the Titanic sank because eye-witnesses did not agree if the ship broke in half before or after it sank.

cbr: According to my brain, my brain is reliable.
source_article: No one can deny that [my theoretical orientation] is the only valid theoretical orientation </s></s> According to my brain, my brain is reliable.

cbr: It is said that we have a good understanding of our universe.  Therefore, we know exactly how it began and exactly when.
source_article:
Billy: How could the universe be 6000 years old when we know the speed of light, the distance of astronomical objects (13+ billion light years away), and the fact that the light has reached us[1]?
Marty: 6000 years is not a firm number.  The universe can be as old as about 10,000 years.
Billy: How do you figure that?... </s></s> It is said that we have a good understanding of our universe.  Therefore, we know exactly how it began and exactly when.

cbr: You should never gamble. Once you start gambling you find it hard to stop. Soon you are spending all your money on gambling, and eventually you will turn to crime to support your earnings.
source_article: People who buy stocks are no different from people who bet on horse racing. They both risk their money with little chance of making a big profit. </s></s> You should never gamble. Once you start gambling you find it hard to stop. Soon you are spending all your money on gambling, and eventually you will turn to crime to support your earnings.

cbr: Everything I say is true. This is true because I said it, and everything I say is true.
source_article: My father told me that the sky is green. So it must be the truth. </s></s> Everything I say is true. This is true because I said it, and everything I say is true.

cbr: You've got to teach the boys logic! If you don't teach them logic, they won't learn how to think, and they'll become hobos and die in prison! Don't you care about your sons? (Mother to Father)
source_article: You've got to teach the boys logic! If you don't teach them logic, they won't learn how to think! And they'll become hobos and die in prison! Don't you care about your sons? Don't you care about your sons? (Mother to Father)

cbr:

Bob: You couldn't be more wrong; the music industry is doing just fine.  I can't believe you think the government should be allowed to regulate what I share with my "friends."  No one wants a world where I can't loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers.

No one wants a world where I can't loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers. </s></s> Charlie: Illegal posting and sharing of songs online is crippling the music industry.
Bob: You couldn't be more wrong; the music industry is doing just fine.  I can't believe you think the government should be allowed to regulate what I share with my "friends."  No one wants a world where I can't loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers.

cbr:
Speaker 1: We should have single payer, government funded health care. That would be the best solution to the health care crisis in our country.
Speaker 2: You voted for Bernie Sanders. You’re probably a communist.
source_article:
Speaker 1: I think we should have single payer, universal, health care.
Speaker 2: Communist countries tried that. We don’t want America to be a communist country. We shouldn’t have single payer health care. </s></s> Speaker 1: We should have single payer, government funded health care. That would be the best solution to the health care crisis in our country.
Speaker 2: You voted for Bernie Sanders. You’re probably a communist.

cbr: This fallacy assumes something is true (or right, or good) because other people agree with it.
source_article: fallacy suggesting that because everyone believes something or does something, it must be valid, accurate, or effective. </s></s> This fallacy assumes something is true (or right, or good) because other people agree with it.

cbr: "She is the best candidate for president because she is better than the other candidates!"
source_article: Now you tell me she looks presidential, folks. I look presidential </s></s> "She is the best candidate for president because she is better than the other candidates!"

cbr: Senator Jones supports a strong national defense. If you do vote for him, our country will be invaded, and it will start World War III.
source_article:
MARVIN STONE: You suggest that we scrap the SALT II treaty already negotiated, and intensify the build-up of American power to induce the Soviets to sign a new treaty - one more favorable to us. President Carter, on the other hand, says he will again try to convince a reluctant Congress to ratify the present treaty on the grounds it's the best we can hope to get. Now, both of you cannot be right. Will you tell us why you think you are?
RONALD REAGAN: Yes. I think I'm right because I believe that we must have a consistent foreign policy, a strong America, and a strong economy. And then, as we build up our national security, to restore our margin of safety, we at the same time try to restrain the Soviet build-up, which has been going forward at a rapid pace, and for quite some time.
October 28, 1980
Cleveland, Ohio
What logical fallacy did Reagan’s response illustrate the use of? </s></s> Senator Jones supports a strong national defense. If you do vote for him, our country will be invaded, and it will start World War III.

cbr:
Hannah argues that because her friend was brainwashed as a child into thinking that people are generally good, people are not generally good.
Name that fallacy:
source_article:
Nicole identified that Hannah had committed a logical fallacy, but instead of addressing the substance of her claim, Hannah accused Nicole of committing a fallacy earlier on in the conversation. </s></s> Hannah argues that because her friend was brainwashed as a child into thinking that people are generally good, people are not generally good.
Name that fallacy:

cbr: Our soccer team was losing until I bought new shoes. We have not lost a game since I got my lucky shoes!
source_article: At soccer practice, Willeidy tells Aida, "Pace's soccer team was losing until I bought new shoes. We have not lost a game since I got my lucky shoes!" </s></s> Our soccer team was losing until I bought new shoes. We have not lost a game since I got my lucky shoes!

cbr: If we allow students to have cell phones, it will lead to chaos in the classroom.  If we have chaos in the classroom, the students will fail to learn.  If they fail to learn, their lives will be ruined forever!
source_article: "It is an outrage that the school wants to remove the vending machines. This is taking our freedom away!" </s></s> If we allow students to have cell phones, it will lead to chaos in the classroom.  If we have chaos in the classroom, the students will fail to learn.  If they fail to learn, their lives will be ruined forever!

cbr: The house is white; therefore it must be big
source_article: Bill lives in a large building, so his apartment must be large." </s></s> The house is white; therefore it must be big

cbr: In government, arguing for raising taxes - "We need more revenue to support the programs that we have. Children are our future. Let's support children."
source_article: Last year, the city of Brookfield allocated more money to public parks. This year, however, littering increased, so the increase in park funding must have been responsible. </s></s> In government, arguing for raising taxes - "We need more revenue to support the programs that we have. Children are our future. Let's support children."

cbr: A commercial claims that a specific brand of cereal is the best way to start the day because athlete Michael Jordan says that it is what he eats every day for breakfast.
source_article: Every day, I eat cereal for breakfast. One time, I had a muffin instead, and there was a major earthquake in my city. I've eaten cereal ever since. </s></s> A commercial claims that a specific brand of cereal is the best way to start the day because athlete Michael Jordan says that it is what he eats every day for breakfast.

cbr: All women care about are their looks.
source_article:
George: Man, those girls are smokin' hot!
Derek: No, they're not. You're a victim of the cheerleader effect. When girls are together in a group, each girl looks a lot better than if you were to see her without the other girls.
 </s></s> All women care about are their looks.

cbr: People are like dogs. They respond best to clear discipline.
source_article: Chihuahuas are good inside dogs. German Shepherds are dogs; therefore, German Shepherds would be good inside dogs, too. </s></s> People are like dogs. They respond best to clear discipline.

cbr: "To get better schools, we have to raise taxes. If we don't, we can't have better schools."
source_article: Look, the only way to improve social programs is to raise taxes. You have to either raise taxes, or accept that the poor and needy are going to suffer. </s></s> "To get better schools, we have to raise taxes. If we don't, we can't have better schools."

cbr: Three congressional representatives have had affairs. Members of Congress are adulterers.
source_article: Three congressional representatives have had affairs. Therefore, members of Congress are adulterers. </s></s> Three congressional representatives have had affairs. Members of Congress are adulterers.

cbr: "We will teach this miserable traitor(Snowball) that he cannot undo our work so easily."
source_article: Your honor, if we let Pinocchio get away with lying, what's next? Stealing? Murder? ... </s></s> "We will teach this miserable traitor(Snowball) that he cannot undo our work so easily."

cbr: I hated the movie because it was the worst movie I ever saw.
source_article:
Bob: that movie was a waste of time and money
Ted: what was wrong with it?
Bob: It sucked

This is an example of? </s></s> I hated the movie because it was the worst movie I ever saw.

cbr:
If Joe eats greasy food, he will feel sick.
Joe feels sick.
Therefore, Joe ate greasy food.
source_article:
Joe eats horribly; therefore, his heart attack was caused by his eating habits. </s></s> If Joe eats greasy food, he will feel sick.
Joe feels sick.
Therefore, Joe ate greasy food.

cbr: No one can deny that [my theoretical orientation] is the only valid theoretical orientation
source_article: "I believe deeply that canceling the fashion show is the best decision. I know it is. I am very certain about it." </s></s> No one can deny that [my theoretical orientation] is the only valid theoretical orientation

cbr: The statement "you are not really an American if you are vegetarian" is an example of which fallacy?
source_article: 'Our family has always been farmers, so we should always be farmers'' is an example of which logical fallacy? </s></s> The statement "you are not really an American if you are vegetarian" is an example of which fallacy?

cbr:
All lions are animals.
All cats are animals.
Therefore, all lions are cats.
source_article:
"All elephants are big. Some boys are big. Therefore some boys are elephants." </s></s> All lions are animals.
All cats are animals.
Therefore, all lions are cats.

cbr: Recognising that Amanda had committed a fallacy in arguing that we should eat healthy food because a nutritionist said it was popular, Alyse said we should therefore eat bacon double cheeseburgers every day.
source_article:
Helga: You should not be eating that... it has been scientifically proven that eating fat burgers are no good for your health.
Hugh: You eat fat burgers all the time so that can’t be true.
 </s></s> Recognising that Amanda had committed a fallacy in arguing that we should eat healthy food because a nutritionist said it was popular, Alyse said we should therefore eat bacon double cheeseburgers every day.

cbr: "I believe that PNoy is the Abraham Lincoln of the Philippines."
source_article: Lahat nakamove-on na ikaw na lang hindi pa. #MarcosIsAHero </s></s> "I believe that PNoy is the Abraham Lincoln of the Philippines."

cbr: We, the people, are going to work together to achieve justice, unity, and integrity.
source_article: We will not rest until we reach a day when not one single veteran falls into homelessness. </s></s> We, the people, are going to work together to achieve justice, unity, and integrity.

cbr: I met a rude person from France yesterday. I guess all French people are rude.
source_article: My mom says that most tourist from France are rude. She had to wait on one the other day and the lady threw her pancakes on the ground because they were not big enough. </s></s> I met a rude person from France yesterday. I guess all French people are rude.

cbr: "The government should not prohibit drugs. Otherwise the government should also ban alcohol or cigarettes. And then fatty food and junk food would have to be regulated too. The next thing you know, the government would force us to brush our teeth and do exercises everyday."
source_article: We have pure food and drug laws; why can't we have laws to keep moviemakers from giving us filth ? </s></s> "The government should not prohibit drugs. Otherwise the government should also ban alcohol or cigarettes. And then fatty food and junk food would have to be regulated too. The next thing you know, the government would force us to brush our teeth and do exercises everyday."

cbr: Misrepresenting someone’s argument to make it easier to attack
source_article: Presenting an unqualified person or institution as a source of credible information. </s></s> Misrepresenting someone’s argument to make it easier to attack

cbr: You're with us or you're against us.
source_article: If you are not with us, you are against us. </s></s> You're with us or you're against us.

cbr: smoking cigarettes is deadly because cigarettes can kill you
source_article: In class, Ryan turns to Doug and says, "Smoking cigarettes is nothing short of suicide: the smoker is willingly killing himself. Duh." </s></s> smoking cigarettes is deadly because cigarettes can kill you

cbr: Fred, the Australian, stole my wallet. Thus, all Australians are thieves.
source_article: Fred, the German, stole my wallet. Therefore, all Germans are thieves. </s></s> Fred, the Australian, stole my wallet. Thus, all Australians are thieves.

cbr: You must obey the law, because it’s illegal to break the law.
source_article:
"You must obey the law, because it's illegal to break the law."

What logical fallacy is used in the statement above? </s></s> You must obey the law, because it’s illegal to break the law.

cbr: My opponent raises a good point, but can we really trust him? I mean, he moved to this town only two years ago, and everyone knows that his wife left him.
source_article: My opponent raised a good point, but can we trust him? I mean he just moved to town only 5 months ago, how much could he really know? </s></s> My opponent raises a good point, but can we really trust him? I mean, he moved to this town only two years ago, and everyone knows that his wife left him.

cbr: Which type of appeal is used in the following phrase from the Declaration of Independence: “He has plundered our seas, ravaged our coasts, burned our towns, and destroyed the lives of our people”?
source_article: If the President arrives in Hawaii, and the next day a volcano erupts, believing that the volcano erupted because the President arrived on the island is an example of: </s></s> Which type of appeal is used in the following phrase from the Declaration of Independence: “He has plundered our seas, ravaged our coasts, burned our towns, and destroyed the lives of our people”?

cbr: Yesterday, I walked under a ladder with an open umbrella indoors while spilling salt in front of a black cat. And I forgot to knock on wood with my lucky dice. That must be why I’m having such a bad day today. It’s bad luck.
source_article: I refuse to stay on the 13th floor of any hotel because it is bad luck.  However, I don’t mind staying on the same floor as long as we call it the 14th floor. </s></s> Yesterday, I walked under a ladder with an open umbrella indoors while spilling salt in front of a black cat. And I forgot to knock on wood with my lucky dice. That must be why I’m having such a bad day today. It’s bad luck.

cbr: This type of propaganda implies that since EVERYONE else is buying a product, so should you!
source_article: This makes you think you need to believe or buy something because everyone else is. Which technique is it? </s></s> This type of propaganda implies that since EVERYONE else is buying a product, so should you!

cbr: You need to go to the party with me, otherwise you’ll just be bored at home.
source_article: Either go to the party or spend the night in your room crying. </s></s> You need to go to the party with me, otherwise you’ll just be bored at home.

cbr: “I know the exam is graded based on performance, but you should give me an A. My cat has been sick, my car broke down, and I’ve had a cold, so it was really hard for me to study!” Demanded Aun.
source_article: "Sir, please let me take the exam. I was late because I need to cook our breakfast and wash the dishes." </s></s> “I know the exam is graded based on performance, but you should give me an A. My cat has been sick, my car broke down, and I’ve had a cold, so it was really hard for me to study!” Demanded Aun.

cbr: There's no point listening to you. Everybody knows you're just a little do-gooder.
source_article: All this time that you're telling me to improve, you're being lazy yourself. </s></s> There's no point listening to you. Everybody knows you're just a little do-gooder.

cbr: I view any discussion concerning the limiting of therapy as morally wrong, that is why I do not accept it.
source_article: I believe one should never deliberately hurt another person, that’s why I can never be a surgeon. </s></s> I view any discussion concerning the limiting of therapy as morally wrong, that is why I do not accept it.

cbr: If you don’t go to the party, then your friends will have fun without you. If your friends have fun without you, then they will stop inviting you to fun things. If your friends stop inviting you to fun things, you will have no social life. Therefore, if you don’t go to this party, then you will have no social life.
source_article: Either you text your friend or you don't have any fun at all. </s></s> If you don’t go to the party, then your friends will have fun without you. If your friends have fun without you, then they will stop inviting you to fun things. If your friends stop inviting you to fun things, you will have no social life. Therefore, if you don’t go to this party, then you will have no social life.

cbr:
Timmy: Mom, what if I don’t believe in God?
Mom: Then you burn in Hell forever.  Why do you ask?
Timmy: No reason.
source_article:
You ask your mother if you can go to the mall with your friends. She says "no". You ask why? She says, "because I'm the mom and I say so". This is an example of which logical fallacy? </s></s> Timmy: Mom, what if I don’t believe in God?
Mom: Then you burn in Hell forever.  Why do you ask?
Timmy: No reason.

cbr: "Coronavirus originated in China, therefore all Chinese people are sick."
source_article: The spider that bit was poison, therefore all spiders are poison. </s></s> "Coronavirus originated in China, therefore all Chinese people are sick."

cbr: Marriage has traditionally been between a man and a woman; therefore, gay marriage should not be allowed.
source_article: “Gay marriages are just immoral. 70% of Americans think so!” </s></s> Marriage has traditionally been between a man and a woman; therefore, gay marriage should not be allowed.

cbr: “You can’t give me a C. I’m an A student!”
source_article: "You can't give me a D because I'm an A student!" </s></s> “You can’t give me a C. I’m an A student!”

cbr: You can either support our police or Black Lives Matter.
source_article:
dude #1: "I support Black Lives Matter's mission to establish and put into better practice restorative justice..."

dude #2: But don't all lives matter?

dude #1: Of course, but I'm telling you about the mission of BLM. </s></s> You can either support our police or Black Lives Matter.

cbr: "Some tall people recently vandalized the park, tall people are irresponsible."
source_article: I hope the art mural at 34th and Habersham will not be allowed. You open the gate for one, you open it for all and you'll have it all over the city. A person wanting to paint on buildings is nothing more than upscale graffiti. More than likely it will go too far. </s></s> "Some tall people recently vandalized the park, tall people are irresponsible."

cbr: We should give the other applicant the job because he has a poor family and he needs to provide for them. It looks like he suffers a lot!
source_article: someone who is poor is more credible than someone who is rich? </s></s> We should give the other applicant the job because he has a poor family and he needs to provide for them. It looks like he suffers a lot!

cbr: We've got to stop them from banning pornography. Once they start banning one form of literature, they will never stop. Next thing you know, they will be burning all the books!
source_article: “Feminists want to ban all pornography and punish everyone who looks at it! But such harsh measures are surely inappropriate, so the feminists are wrong: porn and its fans should be left in peace.” </s></s> We've got to stop them from banning pornography. Once they start banning one form of literature, they will never stop. Next thing you know, they will be burning all the books!

cbr: Free speech is good not just for the individual, but for all of society. After all, it's in the interest of the community that everyone should be at liberty to express his or her beliefs.
source_article: "I have a right to free speech so I can say what I want and you shouldn't try to stop me" is an example of </s></s> Free speech is good not just for the individual, but for all of society. After all, it's in the interest of the community that everyone should be at liberty to express his or her beliefs.

cbr: Siblings Dan and Joe had a serious argument, and Dan told Joe that he hated him and wished that he would get hit by a car. Two days later, Dan was told that Joe had been struck by a car. Dan blamed himself and thought that if he hadn’t made the comment during their fight, Joe would not have been hit.
source_article: Your sister broke her arm, and then you broke your nose. So you assume that a sibling breaking a bone causes you to break one too. </s></s> Siblings Dan and Joe had a serious argument, and Dan told Joe that he hated him and wished that he would get hit by a car. Two days later, Dan was told that Joe had been struck by a car. Dan blamed himself and thought that if he hadn’t made the comment during their fight, Joe would not have been hit.

cbr:
Speaker 1: I think we should lower the age of sexual consent to 16.
Speaker 2: 16 year olds are children. So, you think it’s OK for children to have sex? No, we shouldn’t lower the age of consent.
source_article:
Putting teenagers in sex-education classes is like taking an alcoholic to a bar. </s></s> Speaker 1: I think we should lower the age of sexual consent to 16.
Speaker 2: 16 year olds are children. So, you think it’s OK for children to have sex? No, we shouldn’t lower the age of consent.

cbr: This clinic sure makes a lot of money. Each of the psychologists who work there must earn a large income.
source_article: Companies that make huge profits must be exploiting their customers because the only way a company could make large profits is by taking advantage of their customers. </s></s> This clinic sure makes a lot of money. Each of the psychologists who work there must earn a large income.

cbr:

Edwin: That is ridiculous! How can you possibly be absolutely certain that we evolved from pond scum!
source_article:
Evolution cannot be true. If it were true, we’d all be smelly apes. </s></s> Ted: Biological evolution is both a theory and a fact.

Edwin: That is ridiculous! How can you possibly be absolutely certain that we evolved from pond scum!

cbr: Without this additional insurance, you could find yourself broke and homeless.
source_article:
If you drive without car insurance, then you’re an accident waiting to happen.
Stay protected with Auto Union insurance. </s></s> Without this additional insurance, you could find yourself broke and homeless.

cbr: A woman decides to visit a certain doctor after only asking advice on the best doctors from ONE friend.
source_article: At a party you overhear a friend tell her spouse, “I had high blood pressure at the doctor’s office today; I really need to reduce the stress in my job.” </s></s> A woman decides to visit a certain doctor after only asking advice on the best doctors from ONE friend.

cbr: A few students are misbehaving...therefore the whole class is bad. What fallacy is this an example of?
source_article: While in math class, the student next to you says “math makes no sense, it can’t be real so I must not need this.” What fallacy did this student commit? </s></s> A few students are misbehaving...therefore the whole class is bad. What fallacy is this an example of?

cbr:
All cats are felines.
All dogs are canines.
Therefore, all cats are canines.
source_article:
Atoms are colorless. Cats are made of atoms, so cats are colorless </s></s> All cats are felines.
All dogs are canines.
Therefore, all cats are canines.

cbr: Cell phones stop students from concentrating in class because they are distracting.
source_article: Teachers claim that cell phones distract students, but they only say that because teachers have no lives. </s></s> Cell phones stop students from concentrating in class because they are distracting.

cbr: Dean, the company you work for just filed for bankruptcy! How can I trust you with our money?
source_article: Look Tom, you could go to the police with your information about our questionable accounting practices here at Bentron. But remember, you have a family to feed. Besides you know how rumors of this kind of disloyalty can spread through the industry. You'll ever work as an accountant in this town again. </s></s> Dean, the company you work for just filed for bankruptcy! How can I trust you with our money?

cbr: The spider that bit was poison, therefore all spiders are poison.
source_article: Every person who has ever drunk water has died. Therefore, drinking water causes death. </s></s> The spider that bit was poison, therefore all spiders are poison.

cbr: Misrepresenting someone’s argument to make it easier to attack
source_article: Deliberately using a fake issue or argument against someone because it’s easier to prove wrong than the real issue would be </s></s> Misrepresenting someone’s argument to make it easier to attack

cbr: "You didn't do your homework, did you?" is an example of...
source_article: I did not complete my homework last night? Well, you did not do yours last weak either. </s></s> "You didn't do your homework, did you?" is an example of...

cbr: “Either you love me, or you hate me.”
source_article: Either you love me, or you hate me. </s></s> “Either you love me, or you hate me.”

cbr: Although we have proven that the moon is not made of spare ribs, we have not proven that its core cannot be filled with them; therefore, the moon’s core is filled with spare ribs.
source_article: Although we have proven that the moon is not made of short ribs, we have not proven that its core cannot be filled with them; therefore, the moon’s core is filled with short ribs. </s></s> Although we have proven that the moon is not made of spare ribs, we have not proven that its core cannot be filled with them; therefore, the moon’s core is filled with spare ribs.

cbr: Jack is a good athlete. Jack comes from Canada. Therefore, all Canadians are good athletes."

cbr:
Matt is running for class president. In his campaign speech he says, "My opponent does not deserve to win. She is a smoker and she cheated on her boyfriend last year."
What fallacy has Matt committed?
source_article:
Tim: Boss, you heard my side of the story why I think Bill should be fired and not me.  Now, I am sure Bill is going to come to you with some pathetic attempt to weasel out of this lie that he has created.
 </s></s> Matt is running for class president. In his campaign speech he says, "My opponent does not deserve to win. She is a smoker and she cheated on her boyfriend last year."

cbr: This fallacy suggests that unlikely or ridiculous outcomes are likely when there’s just not enough evidence to think so.
source_article: The research and reasoning that supposedly supports (or that supposedly discredits) this intervention are a joke. The researchers are people who are not methodologically sophisticated and there have been rumors--I have no idea whether they're true or not--that they faked some of the data. The advocates (or opponents) of this intervention are the worst kind of sloppy thinkers. They are fanatical adherents who already have their minds made up; they've become true believers in their cause. They make arguments only a stupid person would accept, and mistakes in reasoning that would make an undergrad psych major blush. These are not the kind of people who deserve to be taken seriously. </s></s> This fallacy suggests that unlikely or ridiculous outcomes are likely when there’s just not enough evidence to think so.

cbr: This fallacy is a distraction from the argument typically with some sentiment that seems to be relevant but isn’t really on-topic.
source_article: It occurs when someone makes an appeal to emotion of pity instead of addressing the argument. </s></s> This fallacy is a distraction from the argument typically with some sentiment that seems to be relevant but isn’t really on-topic.

Senator A: "We should spend less on our military budget and spend more on health and education."
Senator B: "So you want to leave the country defenseless?"
source_article:
Senator: I will vote to increase the defense budget.

Public: Why don't you care about education? </s></s> Senator A: "We should spend less on our military budget and spend more on health and education."
Senator B: "So you want to leave the country defenseless?"

cbr: You either support Hillary Clinton for President or you don't believe in women's rights
source_article: Delores is a big supporter for equal pay for equal work.  This is the same policy that all those extreme feminist groups support.  Extremists like Delores should not be taken seriously -- at least politically. </s></s> You either support Hillary Clinton for President or you don't believe in women's rights

cbr: Yesterday, I walked under a ladder with an open umbrella indoors while spilling salt in front of a black cat. And I forgot to knock on wood with my lucky dice. That must be why I’m having such a bad day today. It’s bad luck.
source_article: I've had bad luck for so long that I'm bound to have good luck now. </s></s> Yesterday, I walked under a ladder with an open umbrella indoors while spilling salt in front of a black cat. And I forgot to knock on wood with my lucky dice. That must be why I’m having such a bad day today. It’s bad luck.

cbr: I'm not surprised, frankly, that someone who gets lost in his own neighborhood would argue that New York has better pizza than Chicago.
source_article: "Everyone who likes pizza likes pepperoni" is an example of </s></s> I'm not surprised, frankly, that someone who gets lost in his own neighborhood would argue that New York has better pizza than Chicago.

cbr: But you have to let me go to the party! If I don't go to the party, I'll be a loser with no friends. Next thing you know, I'll end up alone and jobless, living in your basement when I'm 30!
source_article: If you don’t go to the party, then your friends will have fun without you. If your friends have fun without you, then they will stop inviting you to fun things. If your friends stop inviting you to fun things, you will have no social life. Therefore, if you don’t go to this party, then you will have no social life. </s></s> But you have to let me go to the party! If I don't go to the party, I'll be a loser with no friends. Next thing you know, I'll end up alone and jobless, living in your basement when I'm 30!

cbr: "I had a bad teacher once; therefore, all teachers must be bad."
source_article: When your parent asks you why you have a bad grade in math class, and you answer, "All teachers are the enemy!" </s></s> "I had a bad teacher once; therefore, all teachers must be bad."

cbr: My roommate said her philosophy class was difficult, and the one I’m in is difficult, too. All philosophy classes must be hard.
source_article: "My roommate said her philosophy class was hard, and the one I'm in is hard, too. All philosophy classes must be hard!” </s></s> My roommate said her philosophy class was difficult, and the one I’m in is difficult, too. All philosophy classes must be hard.

cbr:
All hotdogs are fast food.
No hamburgers are hotdogs.
Therefore, no hamburgers are fast food.
source_article:
No animals are insects.
No insects are dogs.
Therefore, no dogs are animals. </s></s> All hotdogs are fast food.
No hamburgers are hotdogs.
Therefore, no hamburgers are fast food.

cbr: You can't give me a C. I'm an A student.
source_article:
Claim: You can't give me a C in this course...
Reason: ... Because I am an A student.
Warrant: An A student is someone who can't receive Cs. </s></s> You can't give me a C. I'm an A student.

cbr: A persuasive technique meant to influence a person’s emotions.
source_article: an attempt to persuade the reader/audience based on feelings or emotions; emotional response </s></s> A persuasive technique meant to influence a person’s emotions.

cbr: The economy continues to grow as the number of “likes” on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked.
source_article: The economy continues to grow as the number of "likes" on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked. </s></s> The economy continues to grow as the number of “likes” on my Instagram account continue to increase. Clearly, the two are linked.

cbr: "Everyone should like coffee: 95% of teachers do!"
source_article: All teachers drink coffee and teachers are people; therefore, all people drink coffee. </s></s> "Everyone should like coffee: 95% of teachers do!"

cbr: “If we let teenagers wear whatever they want to school, they will no longer respect the rules and academic performance will decline.”
source_article: Parents today would rather their kids suppress their identity rather than just be who they are even if it doesn't go with the norm. </s></s> “If we let teenagers wear whatever they want to school, they will no longer respect the rules and academic performance will decline.”

cbr:
Charlie: Illegal posting and sharing of songs online is crippling the music industry.
Bob: You couldn’t be more wrong; the music industry is doing just fine. I can’t believe you think the government should be allowed to regulate what I share with my “friends.” No one wants a world where I can’t loan a book to my girlfriend, let my roommate borrow my iPod, or share a funny meme with my blog followers.

cbr:

Bob: That may be, but you're such a hypocrite! I saw you devour a Triple-Baconator, super-sized fries and 64 ounces of soda yesterday.
source_article:
in response to the claim that "Eating fast food is unhealthy": “But I saw you eat a burger and fries for lunch only a few hours ago!" </s></s> Charlie: Fast food is filled with salt, fat and added sugars. We need better regulation of the industry.
Bob: That may be, but you're such a hypocrite! I saw you devour a Triple-Baconator, super-sized fries and 64 ounces of soda yesterday.

cbr: Every time I was my car, it rains. Me washing my car has a definite effect on the weather.
source_article: Every time I wash my car, it rains the next day. My car washing definitely affects the weather. </s></s> Every time I was my car, it rains. Me washing my car has a definite effect on the weather.

source_article: Everyone loves Rebecca, because she is so popular. </s></s> Everybody loves Raymond because he is so popular. Popular people are loved by everybody.

cbr: Love America or leave it.
source_article: America:  love it or leave it. Either you’re for us or against us. </s></s> Love America or leave it.

cbr: You must obey the law, because it’s illegal to break the law.
source_article: “You should always do what you are being told because following the rules is important.” </s></s> You must obey the law, because it’s illegal to break the law.

cbr:
"Yesterday, you were late for ten minutes. Today you were late for an hour. You know someday, you will simply cease to show up."

source_article:
"Avoid Latam Airlines. Their planes are always late" is what kind of fallacy? </s></s> "Yesterday, you were late for ten minutes. Today you were late for an hour. You know someday, you will simply cease to show up."

cbr: Education is important for the future of the American people and our country.   So, you should choose to study at St. Cloud State University.
source_article: Since many of the students at St. Cloud State University get A's, St. Cloud State must  be a top-rated school. </s></s> Education is important for the future of the American people and our country.   So, you should choose to study at St. Cloud State University.

source_article: He can't be a great athlete; he cheated on his wife. </s></s> There you are cheating on your husband, how could you ever tell us anything meaningful about ethics?

cbr: Mr. Casal is a bad teacher because he stinks.
source_article: Marco cusses a lot, so you can't listen to a thing he says. He's not a good guy. </s></s> Mr. Casal is a bad teacher because he stinks.

cbr: That type of car is poorly made; a friend of mine has one, and it continually gives him trouble.
source_article: My cousin Bob works as a mechanic at Oil Changers and he says that renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind power, aren't going to provide any help in fixing our nation's energy crisis. </s></s> That type of car is poorly made; a friend of mine has one, and it continually gives him trouble.

cbr: Your friend says, "You can't prove that space aliens don't exist, so they must be real." This is an example of which logical fallacy?
source_article:
Morris: Oh youthful spirit, you have so much to learn.  I know for a fact that there are multiple dimensions that beings occupy.
Clifton: How can you possibly *know* that for a fact?
Morris: (raises one eyebrow, stares deeply into the eyes of Clifton and says nothing)
Clifton: Wow. You convinced me!
 </s></s> Your friend says, "You can't prove that space aliens don't exist, so they must be real." This is an example of which logical fallacy?

source_article: You need to go to the party with me, otherwise you’ll just be bored at home. </s></s> But you have to let me go to the party! If I don't go to the party, I'll be a loser with no friends. Next thing you know, I'll end up alone and jobless, living in your basement when I'm 30!

cbr: Free speech is good not just for the individual, but for all of society. After all, it's in the interest of the community that everyone should be at liberty to express his or her beliefs.
source_article: Free trade will be good for this country. The reason is patently clear. Isn't it obvious that unrestricted commercial relations will bestow on all sections of this nation the benefits which result when there is an unimpeded flow of goods between countries? </s></s> Free speech is good not just for the individual, but for all of society. After all, it's in the interest of the community that everyone should be at liberty to express his or her beliefs.

cbr:
All cats are animals.
Some pets are cats.
Therefore, some pets are not animals.
source_article:
Animals tread softly upon the earth without shoes, so all other living beings should follow suit. </s></s> All cats are animals.
Some pets are cats.
Therefore, some pets are not animals.

cbr: Medical Student: "No one objects to a physician looking up a difficult case in medical books. Why, then, shouldn't students taking a difficult examination be permitted to use their textbooks?"
source_article: surgeons have X-rays to guide them during an operation, lawyers have briefs to guide them during a trial, carpenters have blueprints to guide them when they are building a house. Why, then, shouldn’t students be allowed to look at their textbooks during an examination? </s></s> Medical Student: "No one objects to a physician looking up a difficult case in medical books. Why, then, shouldn't students taking a difficult examination be permitted to use their textbooks?"
